Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel for Business Visits”
Reviews.Author: GaryWalter
Reviews.Content: Regal Hotel in Causeway bay is a reasonable business hotel. Its nothing great, but for Causeway Bay, it is way better value usually than the other "5 star" hotels in the area. None of them really rate 5 star. Regal is awkward to get to from taxi point of view, and has way too many loud tourists often in the lobby area, but general facilities for business are ok, the Internet has improved a lot, used to be poor, the general restaurant is very average and noisy, the expensive one is so so, and the gym is a bit pokey and stuck away at the end of a hall in B3 level, no windows, but ok equipment. I have tried cheaper...they are all definitely 3 star levels, I have tried more expensive, and they just are no different, so overall the Regal remains pretty good value for money for the area, just keep your expectations in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: dentalbuddy
Reviews.Content: I make it a point to check tripadvisor before we book into a particular hotel. The reviews for this hotel were generally good but everybody commented on the long waiting time at the front desk for checking and checkout. We arrived on the 31st August and expected a long wait. But, to our surprise, we were shown our rooms in less than 15 minutes after all formalities. The friendly lady at the front desk was very cordial although I can't quite recollect her name. The other staff are not always smiling though and could don a smile when they recognize hotel guests.. The room was very clean and big enough for HK standards. The outstanding thing was the room was nicely laid out and very inviting. The bed was even more comfortable giving a good nights rest after a hectic days shopping. Tried the Wifi, but had to pay for it and I took the 24 hour option on the advice of the front office staff based on their reply that the 24 hours is not 24 hours from the time of first login but will be based on usage. Unfortunately, exactly 24 hours later, my login expired. Check out was equally fast needing less than 10 minutes flat. This hotel is within walking distance of Causeway Bay MTR, Jardine's Bazaar, Times Square and lots of malls. Will definitely stay here the next time around too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, location good, kind of pricy”
Reviews.Author: lenkay
Reviews.Content: everything was good hotel has smoking and non-smoking spacious rooms and amazing bathrooms kind of pricey but if you can afford it go ahead :) don't go for the buffet breakfast...its not that good for the money you pay MUST TRY: this dumpling restaurant in the hotel building..it's amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel - Exec Lounge very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ross W
Reviews.Content: Exec floor was a waste of money - lounge poorly run. Wine and appetizers were not good quality. Lounge manager had very poor attitude. She did not think we spoke Cantonese - very naive. They way she addressed her co workers (who are all younger) was appalling. My customer asked for an umbrella sleeve (it was raining hard outside) and she complained that she would have to call housekeeping. Wifi was free in lounge but had to pay in room (unusual for exec floors where you pay more) No reason to stay at this type of hotel any more with all the boutique hotels in HK where service is prompt and professional. Seemed like a mainland chines tourists were in house - poor combo for business travelers! Great location - but that is all this hotel has going for it...........

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, Hong Kong Regal”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hong Kong Regal was one to remember. Beautiful room, elegantly furnished with all the facilities that one could want. Breakfast, cocktail hour and a 6pm convenient check out included in the price! Situated in the heart of Causeway Bay with MTR just around the corner, everything so convenient! Angela Mak, The Executive Club Manager, was very helpful and cooperative during my stay and made me feel so welcome. A hotel experience to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location but So so Service”
Reviews.Author: Gim Hoe K
Reviews.Content: It is located at Causeway Bay, which is the shopping paradise in Hong Kong. The hotel was packed with guest from China and when a hotel is packed with China guest, you will need to have extra patient as you juz gotto wait for everything - check in, lift, check out etc etc. When I entered the room after check in, around 3pm, not even 5min, the housekeeper opened the door without knocking the door, and luckily I yet to remove my clothes for shower and she apologized and told me that the room was yet to fully make up. I juz wonder how could the hotel allowed guest to check in when the room is not ready. I was then tried to access the paid internet but failed. I called for help 2x, 1st time the front desk told me they will reset the password but it did not work, 2nd time the front desk even asked me to settle it at the front office which I find ridiculous to request an in-house guest to settle it at the front desk, I refused and insisted her to solve the problem, guess what, she said OK then hung up my call, she seemed to be frustrated with my calls. I then raised the complaint and problem solved in between 30 min. Room wise it was a little old but still clean. You will find mirror everywhere in the room which I find a little discomfort for having too many mirror. Overall experience was below expectation due to the service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: speeddolphin
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night here with my husband and our 4 year old son. It's a nice hotel - not fantastic, but certainly not lacking compared to the other hotels in Hong Kong. What you get, though is great location. It's close to the MTR, right in the middle of good shopping malls (where you can get basic amenities), plus great little eateries around the area. There are good dessert places for the evenings (mango pudding, mango sago pomelo and ice cream, you name it!) and late night snacks (HK-style fish balls, beef balls in spicy sauce) within walking distance. In the morning, a short walk down the street will get you great HK porridge with deep fried dough sticks (you tiao).

Reviews.Title: “First visit to HK”
Reviews.Author: Jasmin M
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about - it says the place is five stars but our stay at the hotel wasn't all that memorable. The best thing about it was that it was close to the station and relatively central. In terms of things to be aware of - the service is hard to comprehend, maybe it is just the way things are done in HK but we were hoping for international quality. We had free shuttle service to and from the airport included in our room rate, yet we were told on arrival to the airport that the service is booked out and it was first in, first served. After a difficult and partially lost in translation conversation to the concierge at the hotel, there was a spot on the bus found for us. When we finally got to our room at the hotel, it turned out to be a smoking room. I was surprised no one double checked this with us. Being a non smoker, it was intolerable to be in the room. In addition, traveling with a friend, I have requested two single beds configuration but the room we got had a double bed and we were told there were no other rooms available until the next late afternoon. The guy at the reception asked me if i would mind to share the bed with my friend! We got a fold out bed in the end (at 'no extra charge!') and were relocated to a different room the next day which was good I suppose. We didnt use the restaurant facilities in the hotel - it didn't look or smell that appealing. The roof top pool was basic but ok and so was the gym in the basement. It could do with a little more air conditioning - with three other people working out, it was quite stuffy. All in all - the place in convenient but don't expect international quality of service and even reasonable requests re the beds,, shuttles and a couple of other things were a struggle.

Reviews.Title: “convenient hotel to Times Sq Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: HV G
Reviews.Content: i found it to be a very nice hotel. they provided everything i needed. there is free wifi in the lobby. i visited this past july when we were caught in a typhoon rated 8. there was a lot of rain and wind. hotel was still standing. tree on the street next to it fell. hotel was very accomodating in trying to find out the status of our flight at 05:30 am. we we informed that flight was not canceled. since there was no taxi; we took shuttle bus to the airport express. and made it to the airport. plane finally took off after a 2 and half hour delay. all in all i enjoyed my stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing experience at Hong Kong with a nice GM Mr Alex and Club Floor Manager Angela”
Reviews.Author: Stuart B
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed coming to this hotel, it is my home away from home. Thanks to all the friendly staff in particular Miss Angela Mak! You can even speak freely with the GM inside the elevator, or anywhere else you meet him, and still feel part of the family. Well done guys ! Strongly suggest to book a Club Room or even upgrade frequent viistors to the Club room so they can see they are missing. Suggest even bringing guests to the Club lounge, even though you pay it is still good value and great atmosphere. Looking forward to a wifi upgrade free for guest no.1 and 2 Many Thanks Stuart Ballantyne--CEO Sea Transport Corporation([--])

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm... not really that good for a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Pavel P
Reviews.Content: Okay, my experience with this hotel was sort of disappointing. 1st of all a LONG queue for checking in, which obviously couldn't be handled by the staff. Which made me wait. Then go to the nearest Starbucks to take a coffee. Then wait again. And so on. Overall it took about 2 hours just to check in. Well... I've seen better. Anyways, the windows in my room overlooked neighboring house and underwear dryer. Ok, no big deal, it's HK and we have curtains. Quite a problem to get a taxi from the hotel, there is always a big queue for that as well. Generally my whole stay was about different queues. Apart from that - it's a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only four sun lounges, a lift that takes forever and poor service”
Reviews.Author: happyaquarian13
Reviews.Content: My introduction to this hotel was via a phone call to the Sales and Marketing manager Mr Stephen Tse, he was rude and arrogant and I should have taken warning then that if head of sales could be so rude to a potential customer it wasn’t a good sign for the hotel and its staff. We arrived late at night from a long flight, being in Causeway Bay means it is quite a journey from airport even if you go by MTR and taxi, for a short stay Id definitely stay Kowloon side. Our room was ready and we were surprised at the size for a four star in Hong Kong. We particularly liked the long window seat which was a perfect place to put our suitcases. Nothing else was terribly spectacular about the room , though I was also pleased that we had a separate shower. Everything was clean and in good condition except the air conditioner, the noise was dreadful. We tried turning it down but it made no difference so we turned it off all together which then meant we woke in the middle of the night boiling hot, we turned it back on and just had to put up with noise. The other negative we discovered was the lift, how slow can a lift be? We wasted so much time waiting for a lift. To get to the pool you had to take two lifts, one to the Clubroom floor and then change to take another to the rooftop where the pool is located. As pools go in Hong Kong this is a nice one with no high rise blocking the sun, but what lets it down is the lack of service and the pool furniture, four sun lounges and two tables total !! When we got to the pool at 9am two of the sun loungers were being saved , which seemed ridiculously unfair that the pool guys allowed this, when clearly there is not enough lounges to service guests. We stayed by the pool all day enjoying the sun but not the service. The two pool boys did nothing all day, they didn’t even check the water as they claimed to do every two hours. The two sun lounges being saved were unused for 3 hours whilst other guests had to sit on the concrete, this is outrageous. At every other hotel we have stayed at in Hong Kong pool staff come out regularly with cold towels, and cold water, no such service here. There is a water fountain inside the pool reception area with paper cone shape cups, that is it. Alternatively you can do the long wait at the lift to go down two floors to wait for another lift to take you to your room to get a drink and then do the waiting for lifts to get back by the pool, very poor. At lunchtime we wanted to order some food, we had to go searching for the pool attendants as they were sitting inside doing nothing, certainly not being proactive in offering menus to guests at lunchtime. Then when we made our choices we were told we had to phone ourselves , seriously what were those two pool attendants being paid for , certainly not service. Foolishly we ordered chips with our meal because obviously they had to do the long wait in the lifts and so were stone cold when they arrived. As there are only two tables in the whole pool area and both were being used some friendly guests allowed us to share their table. The dirty plates were still piled on the table from the previous diners, no one had moved them , so we put them on the floor to make room for our plates. When we left the pool area 3 hours later all those plates were still on the floor and piled on the table, such dreadful service, still it was marginally better than the gym which has no service Again after a long wait for the lift heading the other direction to the basement this time, you get to the gym. Access is by keycard and whilst there is a long list of gym rules, including no children under age 12 without supervision and guests must wear appropriate gear this didn’t stop 5 kids obviously under the age of 12 in thongs using up all the cardio equipment for a bit of a laugh leaving serious excercisers wanting for a machine. Once on the cardio machines the tv monitors needed rebooting but of course because there was no one supervising no one knew. We went to the gym on four occasions and every time it was unsupervised and the tv monitors didn’t work. One night we ordered room service, whatever you do, do not order the bolognese sauce, the chef clearly doesn’t know that Bolognese means a tomato based sauce.. this sauce had no tomato and was grey but worse had been flavoured with chinese five spice..served with pasta it was inedible. We wouldn’t stay at this hotel again, besides the fact Causeway Bay is not the best location to stay with little decent shopping around, limited restaurants and devoid of any atmosphere that is Hong Kong or Kowloon the hotel just doesn’t provide any service, where so many others in similar price bracket do. Throw the ridiculous lift system in the equation , the lack of pool furniture , the loud air conditioning and the dreadful food why would you go back?

Reviews.Title: “Has enormous potential, but poorly managed....”
Reviews.Author: travelprincess004
Reviews.Content: We recently had 9 nights on the Club floor. We felt the price was good, however you get what you pay for. The Club Manager (Angela) would scream to her staff in the next room, everything for her was a huge effort. Lucky Andy was there with exceptional service to help make up for the downfall of his superior! The breakfast and afternoon tea on the Club floor was minimal, with no option available to attend the main dining room as an alternative - in fact, they are inflexible on everything. They had a charge for an airport shuttle on our bill in the middle of our stay - the staff do not have the authority to fix this on the spot, so it took some time and phone calls to have it removed. Our room was spacious and clean and we enjoyed the nespresso machine in our room. Our room was quiet even thought it was near a lift. Would I go back? No.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: jimmybyron
Reviews.Content: I wanted something mid range for a 1 night stop over on the way to europe , the regal was up to my expectations for the price range. I booked a room on the business floor ( 32 ) room was fine , of course decorated in a more 90's style asian way, great bed. Some slightly disturbing stains on the lounge chair in the room,,,not sure what they were and can't understand why they would not have cleaned or replaced . it did let the room down a bit. great view and location. One big positive was the nice pool on the roof a little haven away from all the hustle and bustle. I probably would stay here again and if i wasn't so tired from the flight i would have asked to change rooms due to the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family choice for central Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Shones123
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel if you are staying in Hk with a family!! Finding a hotel in Hk where the rooms are large enough or with enough beds to sleep a family of 4 is tricky. We travel to the city a lot and usually struggle to find a hotel for this reason or we have to make compromises and put both children in a single bed or have our youngest sleep with us which makes for a poor night's sleep as he wriggles so much. I wish we had discovered this hotel before. You can request a room with 2 double beds which is prefect. The hotel also has a great roof top pool which the kids loved, has a great location on the edge of Victoria Park and with easy access to shopping and the metro. At check in the staff were extremely helpful. We had arrived early and, although our room was not ready ( the hotel only has a limited number of rooms with 2 double beds), the staff were willing to offer us another room to rest in until they could move us to our room. We also arrived on a day where there was a large political protest taking place nearby and the staff advised us of this and told us to avoid taxis because of the impact on the roads and where not to go. The only downside was that our room was on a smoking floor but the room itself was great and you could not really tell it was on a smoking floor once inside.

Reviews.Title: “forced to stay here by airline cancellation”
Reviews.Author: haroldHood
Reviews.Content: internet did not work, room was not clean, service was rude, bed was hard as a rock,

Reviews.Title: “Another Winner”
Reviews.Author: Kwan_NYC99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regal Kowloon on 5/4 and has a excellent experience. Since my meeting the next week is at the island, I decided to try Regal Hong Kong. I am glad to report the Hong Kong property and staff are as good as the one in Kowloon. Room is clean, service is excellent. I have signed up for the Regal reward program and I checked in via a separate seat down area. The young lady at the reward desk was professional and friendly, I do not remember her name but she's definitely care about what she's doing and it shows. I would rate this as a 4-5 stars property and look forward to use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced & perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: LondonCityAM
Reviews.Content: A friend had described the hotel as 'faded elegance' so I was expecting the worst. However, I was pleasantly surprised - my room was large and quiet and had all the essentials. Room service was fast and efficient and everything worked. The gym in the sub-basement level was functional - just a pity it was in the bowels of the hotel. The lack of any bar area other than the stark and brightly lit lobby was a pity - but didn't ruin my stay. The neighbourhood is good with a good selection of shops and restaurants within a few minutes walk. The roof top pool was quiet on both visits and a nice place to escape for an hour over the weekend. Other than breakfast I didn't eat at the hotel but the restaurants seemed permanently busy drawing a lot of local business - so I assume that the food was pretty good. Overall pretty good value especially if you're happy to trade of a larger room for some 'faded elegance'. Would I stay again - yes.

Reviews.Title: “Value!”
Reviews.Author: Turtle T
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vietnam numerous times a year, and like to stop for a day or two in Hong Kong. Its on my nickel, so I visit the various discount travel sites to find a hotel in the under $125 range. The same five hotels seem to always pop-up: Regal, Hotel Bonaparte, Cosmopolitan, Cosmo and Charterhouse. All are in the Wan Chai/Causeway Bay Area. The Regal is by far the best value of these five. It has a very nice lobby, the rooms are VERY spacious, and the service is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff and poor services.”
Reviews.Author: Jy850922
Reviews.Content: I believe thar Hotel industry is a services industry, although this us needless to say but I have doubt that Regal Hotel understand this. Despite the recent and on-going refurbishment of the hotel the service is rather disappointing. First of all, the lady that helped to check us in showed us with very unpleasant face as seems we are unwelcomed, there was no single gesture, facial expression or even word of welcome. As we arrived early around 1230pm, the lady told us that the check in time is 2pm and we have to come back at 2pm to check in, she gave us a note with hotel room number and informed us that when we're back at 2pm we can just show it to the front desk again to get the room key. So I came back at 2pm sharp and had to queue at the front desk again and passed the note to the front desk after 20mins queue and the person who attended us (another person, next to the lady who attended us earlier) said that it was a wrong room assigned and gave us a different room (not the one given by the lady earlier) which is at lower floor. The front desk also seemed as sales desk to me as we are checking in the people kept selling us extra services which of course needs money - wifi or LAN cable in room (was very surprised the hotel room doesn't even have LAN cable, in which era are we in? Moreover in such developed country like HK?), you need to pay HKD170 per day for Internet, breakfast, room up grade and etc. I was just thinking if the front desk are trained to welcome the guest by selling more and more they could. If you have better room that vacant and no one is taking it up, either you offer it free to hotel guest or just don't mention it. I don't think we need to know how much to upgrade to each room type as we could check it online. The worst happened during my last morning that I checked out (8am), the bell boy informed us that the shuttle bus to HK station is on 20mins interval, and the shuttle bus to airport only arrives in an hour. So we opted for the bus to HK station and transfer to airport express train. To my very disappointment, we waited for 40mins and there wasn't any bus!! I think the hotel should aware that hotel guests are in need to arrive at the airport on time and missing flight is the worst to happen for any traveller. After 40mins (I was kind enough to gave them double of the time interval promised) and I went to the bell boy and asked is he aware that the bus is coming soon? He just replied with very rude face"I don't know".

Reviews.Title: “Causeway Bay Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: pinayflashpacker
Reviews.Content: Requested for a change of room bec. initial room had dirty carpet (1516). Next room (1806) was a renovated one, a bit modernized. Very spacious with 2 beds w/c you can push together, bigger than a king bed. Beds and pillows were soft. With tub and separate shower plus toiletries. With safe, coffee&tea, desk. Views are of buildings, Victoria Park and harbor. Cleanliness wasn't up to standard. Hairs on both shower and tub. AC was kinda loud. No help from bellboys to get taxi and to load bags into taxi. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the box”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_acct
Reviews.Content: Stayed fo four days at the Regal Hong Kong wile in town for business. Overall i was happy with the experience I had. The room was ok, it was kept clean and made up in good time daily. I had no problems with reception staff and most of the other people at the hotel. The only place I did have difficulties was the restaurant on the first floor that is used for breakfast. Staff here were not very nice, verging on the rude especially when seeking a signature for the breakfast docket. The gym was good with very few people using it, so it was easy to get on machines. Also it is open 24 hours, useful if your body clock is out of whack. It is well located in Causeway Bay, close to retail options. It is also close to the MTR, as well as on the tram line. So apart from a couple of sour staff it was overall an OK experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but with challenges”
Reviews.Author: tsgbhalf
Reviews.Content: Service was inconsistent. Some excellent (Bono, the bellman is unbelievably good), some average. Checkout process seems slow. Not a lobby type hotel with chairs, couches etc. Fitness center was dirty. My room was quite clean. Meeting rooms were clean and well serviced. Meeting room food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Regal Hong Kong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine C
Reviews.Content: Modern and spacious room, location near Sogo and Time Square shopping centre. Nearby area many HK cafe and other eating place etc wanton noodle house and porridge. Very unfriendly Lobby area no sofa or chairs to rest or sit for family with children's or infant while waiting for check in or check out. Taxi to Disneyland HK 200 dollars around 45 mins or Ocean Park HK 60 dollars 20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “The worst and most overpriced Hotel in the WORLD...”
Reviews.Author: mlmcasual
Reviews.Content: In all my travels abroad- This is by far the Most overpriced, worst hotel I have ever been to IN THE WORLD. 300$ USD a night, beds that are hard as rocks, small old rooms, internet costs 20usd and up, The hotel's restarurant charged 45$ USD for a crappy salad and soup. This place is the beggest EFING Joke I have ever seen. It's so bad it's like a parody from an SNL skit on absurdly crapy overpriced hotels. It's unreal how bad this is.

Reviews.Title: “great pleasure”
Reviews.Author: cardioswiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights with a baby ( 18 months). We had great pleasure in this hotel. When you come in, there is a very comfortable smell of a fresh parfume in the lobby. When we arrived, there was no queue and could check in very quickly. The room was nice with an outstanding bathtub in the bathroom ( round and very big). I enjoyed it particulary. The location is also very good, in the heart of the very animated Causewaybay, with lots of restaurants and shopping in the neighbourhood. We had breakfast everyday in the coffeeplace in the lobby ( we had no breakfast included), with very kind staff, especially with our baby. We did not test the pool because of the weather.

Reviews.Title: “No service, no understanding”
Reviews.Author: xplorer37
Reviews.Content: I woke to find no hot water in shower. No apology, not sure if they have fixed for tomorrow. "free Internet" in lobby is only free for 2 hours total from the time you first access it. If you are there 4 days & access when first arrive, no free Internet for the next 3+ days! When it doesn't work don't think they will waive fee for room access, the Mgr showed no concern at all for the lack of the lobby Internet working, forcing me to use the paid service for a few minutes. He refused to take charge off, even knowing from employee I complained to & showed the service not working. Another note, the food in this hotel is mediocre for a high price. The area of Hong Kong offers little so if you want shopping or dining, try another area. Will update further when I try to get I Prefer & American Airline credit for my stay. Overall I will avoid all Regal properties in the future based upon my experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not exactly 5-star quality except for the Club Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: AileenSingapore
Reviews.Content: The moment I arrived at the Regal Hong Kong, I was overwhelmed with the crowd at the lobby. Boy, was it crowded and noisy! Thankfully, I was booked on the club floor so i was immediately guided to the private check-in on a different level. I felt like I entered a different hotel altogether. The floor was more tastefully decorated and all the staff were extremely attentive and helpful. The room was a good size given that this is Hong Kong and the hotel is located at Causeway Bay! Bed was very comfortable. Location is excellent as the hotel is located just about 5 minutes walk to the main shopping belt in Causeway Bay. Food is never a problem with many cafes and local eateries around the hotel. For the Karaoke fans, there is a huge Karaoke just across the hotel to croon your night away! If you plan to stay at the Regal Hong Kong, go for the Club Rooms!

Reviews.Title: “my home in HK”
Reviews.Author: Robert A
Reviews.Content: A perfectly located hotel with an excellence of service. Specially recommend staying at the fabulous executive floor rooms! You will have a very preferential service and their manager Ms Angela Mak is the most helpful and efficient person you will find in the business. Excellent views from the rooms as well as from their Zeffirino restaurant. She go extra miles to show me the Suite and bok thru Regal web is good price. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “GUEST INJURED - 1Star Treatment by supposed 5Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SEABoys
Reviews.Content: I stay in Hong Kong regularly and the standard of hotels is excellent. Personnel in Hong Kong hotels can never do enough for you. However, at this hotel I sustained an injury by falling in the shower. The floor of the shower is not suitable for the purpose it was designed - extremely slippery when wet. They do provide a small bathmat that is inadequate for the area of the shower floor. As a direct result of the hotel's failure to secure the safety of the shower for their guests, I fell and severed an artery in my wrist (I am only 34 years old so this is not expected). The injury was of a serious nature and all Duty Manager’s showed concern and agreed taht the bath mat was too small for the shower area when they inspected it. I had to attend the hospital and a Doctor gave me stitches and presented me with a bill for 7600$. I then gave this to the hotel, given that the staff had admitted liability. However, when I met with the VP for International Sales, he refused to accept the liability that his staff had already admitted and refused to pay! Just to add insult to injury, the hotel delivered additional 4 mats to my room to cover the whole area, 2 days after the fall and 1 hour before I checked out! A sure admission that there is an inadequacy in their bathroom set up (see attached). I was astounded. 5Star hotels build their reputation on caring for their guests. My bill for the room was double the cost of the hospital bill (I was staying in their Club Floor) and yet the person at the very top of the Regal Hotel group does not live by the standards set by the industry. Super disappointing and totally out of character for the usual high standards set at HK hotels - in fact 5Star hotels internationally. There is something terribly wrong when the person running the hotel and the group does not live by the 'Your Satisfaction Is Our Goal' mantra that is posted in their email signature. Shame on you Regal Hotel and I feel sorry for your staffs that were undermined by your arrogance and inability to handle my case fairly. Your staff showed genuine concern and apologized while you were too scared to admit your faults. There are so many EXECEPTIONAL hotels in Hong Kong and this hotel is relatively expensive given the facilities available (rooms are tired and I had to request a re-clean when I arrived). Stay anywhere in Hong Kong, but do not stay here. Enjoy true hospitality and excellent service elsewhere.......

Reviews.Title: “Pay and pay”
Reviews.Author: Robin T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about pay and pay! I booked with a early check in option and arrived from US a the hotel around 10am, and had to wait at the lobby until 2 pm to be able to check in. Internet access, have to pay extra I took the shuttle to airport on return, I have pay extra 130. Because I booked the room with 3 people, I got one with king size bed, but the shuttle say the room is for 2 people, so had to pay for another head to take the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant (timewarp) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coober
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights on a business trip/convention. Arrived early and got the upgrade to the Exec. Floor/Room. So I could get into my room a little earlier. Good size room & bathroom (for Hong-Kong). Had all the bids and pieces You would expect and it all worked. The décor is very interesting, Some of the best quality vinyl seats (lounge and lobby) I have seen In years, that combined with the décor of tons of marble, crystal chandeliers etc.. makes this place somewhat funky – Retro. Anyway the staff at reception were typically efficient but cold (check out the painting of the hunting scene at reception that might explain it) The upstairs Exec. Lounge served coffe and drinks, day/night, basic but nice view ( I liked it) The breakfast, included with the Exec. Upgrade was very good and served in a Lovely room with a view. Very good location, close to transport, shopping, Restaurants and Convention center. I do have one complaint, the security staff refused to Let anyone Sit in the lobby unless you bought coffe and cake. What is that?? Lighten up or provide alternative seating for your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Cigarette butt and turd got us a free upgrade...”
Reviews.Author: Dyl82
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Rooms feel quite cramped. We got upgraded because of the prob mentioned in title. I was at a loose end and needed to use the Internet... Which costs 15 euros (170HKD) just to connect!! It's ok... But I wouldn't recommend it given the wide range of choice out there. It was ok value for money because we only paid about 75 euros a night - and for an upgraded room. Any more than that and I'd say "bad deal!!!"

Reviews.Title: “One of the staffmember fooling me while I wanted to extend my room”
Reviews.Author: Joeoej
Reviews.Content: First, I am little bit disappointed, because of the chorus of praise for the staff members which you can read here. Most of them are really friendly and helpful, but what I find out today I never seen in a 5 star hotel before. While wanting to extend my hotel room for another 7 days in the executive lounge as a executive member, the lady on the front desk asked me for the room number and checked my status, seeing I was booking with an travel agency, she didn´t know exactly what to do, so she asked a lady sitting not at a front desk but two seats beside of me, I think she was one of experienced staff doing a break, this lady doesn´t even talked to me, instead of it saying something on Chinese to the front desk lady. So the front desk lady told me I would better book with the travel agency or on internet. I told her I prefer to extend the room here and not on internet because I want to pay in cash, meaning I don´t want my creditcard to be charged. Now the lady two seats beside of me starting to say something in Chinese again and laughing at me stating, how I can pay cash to the internet. So I need to explain here again, that I want to pay in the hotel and not with the credit card via internet, she just continue talking in Chinese with the other statt members. The other staff members tried to me friendly meanwhile. Anyway I don´t think thats how hotel visitor should be treated like.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Alan B
Reviews.Content: I am disabled and have found the staff of this hotel very, cheerful and helpful they are only too willing to be of assistance. I must say also my stay at the hotel was very pleasnat and would recommend it as a stop over for travel as I used it.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VivecaSingapore
Reviews.Content: Whats good? The staff were fabulous. I loved my glorious room (but not the location). I will be back and have learned which rooms not to stay in! (not right next to the lift) Whats not so good? Long check in and out. The internet was pricy when I only used 3 hours of internet. I think they should have an hourly rate. My room was right by the lift and the local chinese speaking ladies were shouting in the corridors at 3am at the top of their voices without a care for other sleeping guests. (although I realise that the Hotel cannot be held responsible for the inconsideration of some people)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice whilst on business”
Reviews.Author: adzbee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October last year for a week. Have been travelling to HK for 4 years on business, usually staying in Wanchai, was looking for something less central and better value. Regal Hong Kong was a great find. Location, service and the executive club facilites all exceeded expectations. I have already booked again to stay in April and will likely stay here again whenever in HK.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: sammy778
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but the staff was very helpful and the room was great. The small portions restaurant down stairs was world famous. We love Hong Kong a world class walking city, I miss it already

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard”
Reviews.Author: Amac27
Reviews.Content: I arrived after a journey of almost 24 hours and just wanted a shower, a change of clothes and something to eat. It took about ten minutes to check me in even though I had booked and they kept trying to upsell me to a more expensive room, made me sign about four different credit card vouchers and took about five minutes just to explain how to get the internet to work. All of this when I was so tired I thought I might fall asleep before the process was completed. I ended up going for the upgrade and am not necessarily sure it was worth it. My view was of the boring (ie mountain) side, the free breakfast was pretty pedestrian and the waiter gave away my table while I was waiting for them to fix the coffee machine. When I brought this to his attention he invited me to go and sit in the lounge until somebody else finished enjoying the view. The room was fine, but I was unfairly comparing it with the stunning suite with a view I had the last time. Also minor details such as the presence of gin but no tonic in the minibar were frustrating when you arrive with your body clock messed up and just want one drink before bed. The location is fun with all the sights and sounds of Causeway Bay close at hand. The staff are well-meaning but need to be told exactly what to do rather than anticipating what you might want or need. This place could be great but somehow there is just something lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Skiier404
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was good so book with this included! Uprgrade definately not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: spj709Sydney
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on a business trip in a club room. It was very comfortable and enjoyable. Breakfast was quiet good, though the club room was very basic at night for a drink and service was slow. Overall though we very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “2-min walk from metro station”
Reviews.Author: willwu2000
Reviews.Content: 1-block away from Causeway Bay station. relatively large room and bathroom for hong kong. very well maintain. clean. staff helpful despite being very busy that weekend. good sound barrier, can't hear outside traffic nor hallway conversations. same building as Din Tai Fung restaurant, one of the best restaurant in hong kong famous for their steamed buns. very close to shopping areas. in center of hong kong. would stay again. good hotel choice for family, couples, business, or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excelent services, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: Stevie S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to 2 malls, a lot of local restaurant, MTR station, free internet access at lobby, delicous breakfast and the room's perfect. It's very convinient

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided!”
Reviews.Author: cedshanghai
Reviews.Content: 1/ Front desk over selling for an upgrade 2/ Location very noisy 3/ Room very 80's 4/ Internet connection not working but charged! 5/ 20 min hard negotiations at the check-out to get compensated 6/ Curtains in the room must have been hanged 20 years ago 7/ TV light was heavily aggressive and could not be switched off 8/ mouthwash being charged at HKD 18, for a room of HKD 2,450 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Cost effective and convinient”
Reviews.Author: AlbeeTheOne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regal hotel for business, and found their website very easy to navigate and book a room. I chose the hotel since it was close to my client, and the Causeway Bay MTR train stop helps in terms of connectivity when you feel like a tourist. The hotel is across the street from Victoria Park, and has a north view towards the Harbour. The room was small, but so are most of the rooms at the HK rooms that I stayed previously. The staff was courteous, and the check-in/out process was well managed. The hotel serves a nice breakfast buffet. They have a pool at the rooftop, and a gym in the basement. They have a small business center too for use.

Reviews.Title: “Nice causeway bay location, beside the tram stop”
Reviews.Author: HappyHomemaker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in Nov11. Room was clean and bright, though a bit small. Just 2 hiccups after we got to the room - the safe did not work, and the toilet seat did not stay up. We had 2 staff come in to repair these, the safe was fixed after 15 min, while the toilet seat would not cooperate even after around 30 minutes of being taken apart, hammered, poked, etc. other than that, housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful. Check in and check out was very quick and efficient. Best part for me about this place is its location. Its a very short walk to sogo, windsor house, the mtr and victoria park, and around 10 min to times square. It is also right beside the tram's causeway bay terminus and 2 minutes from the general tram stop. When travelling with young children, i would take the tram over the mrt as it is less crowded and less distance to walk. Of course, this is only true if you are going around the tourist spots on hk island, as the tram network is not as extensive as the mtr. Breakfast at the hotel is so so, but there is a good congee and rice roll shop if that is your thing, a few doors from the nearest 7-11. You can also get good beef and pork jerky from the bee cheng hiang across sogo. Would also recommend that you try din tai fung in the same building.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: 2plus1
Reviews.Content: Booked with Wotif and paid an extra HK$990 for an extra bed. Correction, it's a plywood board with a 2 inch mattress on it. They ran out of rollaway bed that night. Asked housekeeper to put another 2 layers of the same type of mattress but she refused to comply. She can add only more blankets to cushion it. We had to speak to manager (Edgar) whom we must appraise him for making an effort to search for a proper rollaway bed. Room is extremely small and as there's no other bigger room for that night, we make do with it for a night since they are changing room for us the next day. We are pleased with a more decent-sized room but again, the 3rd bed is missing. Here comes the housekeeper again with her plywood board and 2 inch mattress. We were so fearful of going thru' the hassle all over again. She recognized us and promptly replaced with the rollaway bed. Beware! What type of extra bed they give you. Plus point of this hotel is its strategic location like what others had reviewed. However, the circular overhead bridge accessing the hotel is probably the favourite gathering and picnic place every Sunday for foreign domestic workers.

Reviews.Title: “Location~ 5* Staff @ Reception~ 2*”
Reviews.Author: leongkat
Reviews.Content: I checked in this hotel on 15 Dec and checked out on 18 Dec. The location was wonderful with a food street nearby, metro in 3 minutes walk and Times Square just across the road. The room given to me was great too! Huge and comfortable. Only flaw, but disturbing, was the super slow reception service. Despite only a few of us in the queue at 4ish pm om a Thursday, I waited close to half an hour for my turn to check in. And to my horror, I was told the room was not ready. No apologies and no explanation. I was told to go for my shopping and returned later. Worst still, they didnt seem to smile at all. I didn't expect Disneyland service, but sometimes a smile was all it needs. I was half joking to my sister, perhaps the company is not paying any bonuses or has a budget cut on training. Last thing, no mention about free WIFI in the lobby. I was told when i asked the reception I need to log in using my room number. And boy, i need to pay! This was my only experience in past half year that no free WIFI in a 5 star hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and value”
Reviews.Author: csttoronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regal Hong Kong for 8 nights at the beginning of November. After arriving on a 15 hour flight from Toronto I used the Air Express train to get into the city then connected to a free shuttle bus for the 10 minute drive to the hotel. Everything worked seemlessly. I was so pleased at first with the ease and gracious check-in, then with the large and well appointed room, One of my pet-peeves about hotels is guest rooms with windows that do not open. After inspecting my room, I noticed that the windows could open but were locked. I contacted the front desk and within 5 minutes staff were unlocking the windows. The hotel is well located near the Causeway Bay underground station and on the main tram line. The surrounding area is filled with restaurants, shops and shopping malls. It is a 5 minute taxi ride to the new Conference Centre or a 15 minute walk. I took my breakfast in the main restaurant on the 2nd floor. It is a bright room and the fairly priced breakfast buffet has a generous selection of North American, European and Chinese items. There is a One Star Michelin rated Chinese restaurant on the 3rd floor and an Italian restaurant on the 37th floor, alas I did not dine in either. During my stay, I always found the room well cleaned upon my return each day, The concierge staff were very helpful arranging tours and transfers. Check-out was quick with no concerns with the final billing. When I am next in Hong Kong, I will likely stay at the Regal as it is CLEAN - CONVENIENT - COST-EFFECTIVE

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: ChicChik
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that it is close to all the buzz of shopping havens! Nothing less for ChicChick! The hotel provides a free shuttle service to Hong Kong station where you can check in your luggage. One negative point is that the shower stall pools up. And I noticed a strand of hair stuck on the wall -- this shows that the housekeeping is not as thorough as what it's supposed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Basquiatlim
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 7 day stay at this hotel, and I can recommend it. The location is almost perfect. It's a 10 minute walk to the subway stations, 2 minutes to the trams and 2 minutes from lots of eating places, and shopping. I highly recommend taking the Trams as they traverse the length of Hong Kong island and are amazingly cheap at 2.30 HKD which is about 30 cents US (!!) and offers a slow, relaxing view of the city. The tram stop is just outside the front door of the hotel. The nearby area is very busy at all hours of the day and is, I suppose, part of the Hong Kong experience. If you prefer Starbucks or McDonalds, they are also closeby. A public sports field and the Hong Kong Central Library are about 5 minutes away. There's a jogging track at the sports field which has a soft surface and is good for joggers not wanting to run through the streets of Hong Kong. The hotel provides a shuttle service to and from the airport which is very convenient though travel time is long--about 1 hour 30 minutes as it makes stops at other Regal Hotels and has to make it's way through Hong Kong traffic. If you decide to take the MTR from the Airport, you get off at the Causeway Bay station. On my departure I decided to try the MTR Airport Express which was also very easy to do and took maybe 30 minutes. I didn't try any of the restaurants, gym or pool facilities as I was busy shopping, eating and sightseeing during the day and even evenings. Our room was spacious, well-appointed, beds were comfortable. An electric kettle was provided and the bathroom provided a shower and bathtub. There's a refrigerator which contained drinks and snacks. An in-room safe deposit box was available for use and it was large enough to fit my 11.6 inch laptop, other electronic gadgets and valuables while we were out. Our room was quiet and I slept well. There's also large screen TV. The hotel was well maintained and the lobby area is quite pretty. The christimas decorations are now up and are quite beautiful. I would certainly consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4/5 star experience.....”
Reviews.Author: Mike__R0ss
Reviews.Content: This hotel, like most of Hong Kong, is bustling and not friendly place, even the concierge seems to be rushed and have not time to make a person feel comfortable in HK. The rooms are very small and all services, including food, are very expensive. Room was freezing cold and it took 4 hours to get a portable heater. The floor butler did not speak english and was of no help. They charge $20 for wi-fi and the service was impossibly slow speed. The front desk manager was not helpful when I tried to change my reservation. About the only positive things I can say about this hotel is that it is in a decent location and the room was clean. I will not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Caring hotel and GM, friendly staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to choose Regal Hotel Causeway Bay this time instead of Excelsior to feel a difference on this trip, we read the comments here and was so worried as we wanted to enjoy ourselves and when we come back from our day out, to rest and enjoy the evening together. Mr. Farmer is an excellent host with a strong team in the executive club, special praises to Angela Mak, Minah, Andy, Oscar, Billy and Edgar (very good man - made me felt so welcome with a phone call and then setting up the wifi booster for us) and the rest of the team that made our stay so warm and friendly. We really felt at home with a lot of support and help from the team. The rooms are being refurbished, so there will be noises. When we checked out, the room next to us was having its carpet changed, and this means that Regal is upgrading as much as they can to make it a great stay. The toilet paper is thin but then again you can ask for more toilet rolls, not a problem. The water pressure was good, although we could not adjust it and the room was cosy. Whenever we had problems, we called housekeeping or reception and was always provided a quick response. well done to the team. Swimming pool looks nice we didnt swam but the view from the roof you can take good pictures of the stadium. Great View! We were provided Room 1910 during our stay from 30/10/2011 to the 3/11/2011. I feel very strongly that this hotel has a very good future and is blessed with a caring GM. We spoke to the GM when he was in his rounds one morning at the breakfast lounge on 31st floor on the bad internet connection and in the evening, we were provided with a booster and we had no problems connecting after that, too bad it happened on the day before we checked out though. However, we had dinner at the chinese restaurant on the 3rd floor on our last night and we just wanted to note that the welcome letter should be worded better as we thought the entire meal would have been the 15%-30% discount but we found out that only selected dishes was discounted, therefore the fish we had was not.. we didnt really mind but wished in future that on that welcome letter, to have it worded better to ensure there is no confusion. One thing we did pointed out to the lady taking comments on the 31st floor breakfast time was the lobby reception, at times it was like walking into a police station or igloo as the staff there could give you the coldest stare, as if we are not welcome even when they open the door for us to go out. This is subjective but I felt a bit uneasy every time we went downstairs and wish that the people was just a bit friendly. A smile is very important as most people is paying a lot of money to stay at the Regal, at least a thank you smile to say hey thank you for choosing Regal. We really want you back, I think a suitable customer service training will be good for the lobby staff, some of them do look like security guards, which is good, in a sense. , All in all, our next trip to Hong Kong, we definitely will come back to Regal. The beds are cosy, the room is large enough and you get good views from your room. If you are not happy when you are there, just speak to Mr Farmer, and as you can see from the replies, I believe he is making a lot of good things happen at the Regal. One last thing if you could let Andy from the 31st lounge know that we will hope he will be able to show us where is the special roasted goose he is telling us about. (he says it is as good as yung kee at central) It is always good to get a local to tell you where the good food is, Too bad Andy told us on our last day when we waiting for our shuttle bus to the airport, and Angela if you see this, thank you for all your help and concern, you work really hard, we appreciate it! Hope you guys enjoyed the cookies :).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Pamela028
Reviews.Content: Ok... So I'm just back from a two day night stay at the Regal and despite all the bad trip advisor reviews I read before my stay I must report that I was not only surprised with the hotel but was absolutely delighted with it! First of all the hotels lobby is lovely and I was impressed the moment I entered the hotel doors, then after an easy checkin I made my way to the room where I opened the door to what was simply a gorgeous bedroom - very 5 star indeed. There was a plate of complimentary fruit and chocolates left for me too which was a nice surprise also. The next morning I used the roof top pool which boasts great views of the city. The pool area isn't massive with just a few longers so it I could imagine it could get very busy in the summer months. Its probably important to mention the rate I paid for the room- i paid €100 per night. I booked online... I actually think this was a deal to support the fact that they were laying new carpets in the hotel. I was on vacation in the city so this sort of thing doesn't bother me one bit. The only main dissappointment I had about the Hotel was the Real Palace restaurant on the 3rd floor. The food was very average and the staff werent helpful or even that nice either. Our table was wonky in that it was sloping to one side(my glass of wine almost fell on my lap) when I pointed this out to the staff they simply mOved the table around in the middle of my meal and werent very apologethic.they charge 10% service charge to the bill which to be honest I felt the meal wasn't worthy of.... Also the restaurant room itself is also very open and bright which results in a very clinical atmosphere, not the kind of ambience you'd expect from a find dining restaurant. The hotels located near the busy causeway shopping area... Just a two minute walk. The MRT is also close by as is Starbucks, McDonalds, and 7 Eleven is name but a few handy shops on the hotels door steps. Ultimately the restaurant is very disappointing but the hotel is fab and located on a brilliant area.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hotel - maybe 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: G O
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't come near this one, there is no way on earth this is 5 star! My shower was full of black hair and shampoo lids. Obviously had not been cleaned in a while. The carpets are stained and dirty and the whole hotel is in need of a massive make up. I would certainly never stay here again and oh internet is HK$170 per 24 hours - crazy rate. I am really annoyed I have even paid for this room at all. You can feel the wires on the bed mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Service lacking”
Reviews.Author: GodofGamblers
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 34th floor club floor included breakfast. Booked online for discount. From arrival to checkout service is horrible. Everyone is rude here. I have stayed here many times always on club floor because regular rooms stink and are dirty. Do not book club floor because breakfast is horrible as well. There is nothing to choose from. I keep coming back because I can find a good price online but every time I stay, it pisses me off how rude the staff are, especially on club floor. This is the only hotel in hk that I know of that charges you for an adaptor. Shower has no water pressure. Staying on club floor requires u to exit on 31st floor and take another elevator to 32-34 floors. In the second elevator you have to swipe room card to use elevator, it takes an average of five swipes to register. Very annoying. Oh yeah, the toilet paper they use, I fold twice so there is four layers, it rips very easy. You will end up with crap on ur hands if u r not careful. Went to Italian restaurant for late night snack. Ordered a duck pasta dish, pasta tasted store bought and not fresh and duck taste was so overwhelming, not what i would expect after spending nearly 300 hkd (40us) on a single dish with a serving the size of a regular rice bowl. I really don't know what positive things I can comment about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Peter A S
Reviews.Content: The Regal Hongkong Hotel provided my wife and I with the best experience that we have had in 40 years of International travel. The staff were really well trained, very attentive and helpful. We witnessed them handle two very difficult guest related problems during our stay and did so in a very professional way with minimum disruption to other hotel guests. The Club Lounge staff - Andy & Akeibu were extremely helpful and did a terrific job looking after the guests during both disruptions. The Executive Club manager - Angela was exceptionally good. She resolved both disturbences in a quiet, plesant yet forceful manner. What an asset for anyone in the service industry. Thank you all for a very memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappoining!”
Reviews.Author: LaurentPerrier
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel during a business trip. My colleague booked me a room on the eight floor, which is the first floor with rooms, as I want to stay as close to the ground floor as possible. Other members of our party slept on the top floor. Checking in was very difficult as the receptionist wanted us all to check The room was small, dark and very smelly because of years and years of accumulated cigarette smoke. It showed its age and was screaming for a renovation.The carpet was stained.The bathroom was also small with only a bad (and cheap curtain), basin and toilet. Breakfast in this hotel is even more disappointing than my room was. I opted for an Espresso together with a doughnut. The espresso turned out to be a huge cup of normal coffee, while this was my first doughnut ever without any taste whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTrav
Reviews.Content: I agree with another review that this is a nickel and dime hotel. There is a fee for mouthwash - very tacky. Why even offer the mouthwash in the bathroom if it's not for free? Also, there are only 2 power outlets in the room, which are located next to each other in the corner of the room by the desk. They are 3 prong outlets that my universal travel converter would not fit (and it fit previously that week in another Hong Kong hotel). They have an adapter FOR SALE in the room. Housekeeping had to bring a black box converter, the size of a shoebox, for me to use electricity. It's a joke that it is so challenging for me to just recharge my phone. I would not recommend this hotel for business travel. The rooms are clean and basic, but I think the hotel considers itself a top Hong Kong hotel, which it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building - Unbelievably Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Contraidentukl
Reviews.Content: I am not sure how this place is rated at 5-stars. I booked and prepaid for a room through booking.com. When I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by a receptionist who was quite rude. On booking.com, I had booked a room for two adults with a request for a third bed. For an unknown reason, there was confusion between booking.com and your sales/reservations office. The receptionist told me that I had not booked a room with two beds, nor had I booked a room with a third bed. I tried to explain to her the type of room I booked, the third bed I had requested and prepaid for, and the total US Dollar value I had prepaid - in order to explain that I had already paid for three bed accommodation. As I tried to explain this to her, she interrupted me several times, and her body language made it clear that she was not listening to a word that I was saying. I felt like she believed I was lying to her. Further, as I was trying to explain to her what I had paid for and the accommodation I was expecting, she asked me how much I had paid. I told her I paid somewhere in the neighborhood of $611. She then had the audacity to take out a piece of paper, write down the rate in HKD for each of the three days, add the numbers together, and ask me what USD/HKD exchange rate I would like to use. Then, she told me that the value was nowhere near $611. This was pretty demeaning - implying either that I could not do basic arithmetic or that my short term memory was insufficient. The receptionist then told me that my room was not ready (it was 6PM) and that I would have to pay (for a second time) for a third bed, unless I could produce a confirmation from booking.com. I asked her if I could sign onto the internet to show her the receipt on my email account, but I was denied. She told me if I wanted to pay for the internet, I could show her the confirmation, or I needed to go find somewhere with free wifi to download the form to my iPhone. I was disappointed in the events that transpired. First, I was disappointed that a room was not ready at 6PM for check-in. Second, I was completely taken back at the way I was treated by the staff. Not only was the receptionist rude and offensive, but the doormen and the concierge were also not interested in customer service and friendliness in general. Third, I could not believe that the burden of having to work out the problem between the Regal Hong Kong sales office and booking.com fell upon me. Booking.com is the Regal Hong Kong's sales partner, and I believe that any discrepancies or issues should be worked out by the hotel staff and management, and NOT by the customer. If you stay here, don't let the staff ruin your visit. It might be a good idea to phone ahead a day or two to make sure that they have you in the system correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok experience with not so friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: almansor11
Reviews.Content: It was very busy travel season in HK and this hotel was no exception. Check-in was slow as the line was long and room wasn't ready at 5 PM. Took us 30 mins to get the room. Room features were within our expectations, and room itself was clean. Staff was not friendly, I suppose this is because they have to deal with large crowd of travelers. Other than that, everything else is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TK1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my wife for 3 nights from 17/8 based on a recommendation from a friend. Booked an Executive clubroom via the hotel website. This deal included airport transfers, breakfast, free in room wi-fi and club lounge facilities. The airport transfer runs on a schedule with the 1st bus at 7.45 am which when you arrive at 5.30am means a fair wait. Whilst the transfer was fine we opted for the airtrain for the return journey as the return schedule meant sitting around the airport for far too long. We arrived at the hotel at approx 9am to be advised that our room would not be ready but we were offered access to the gym to change and then our bags were held pending our room availablity. Plentiful ideas for a local area exploration were offered by the staff. We returned at approx 11.30 to be greeted by the news that our room was ready. The room and its amenities were superb. We used the roof top pool which was a great way to cool off from the HK heat. The breakfasts were superb with many options from hot food to pastries to fruit to cereals. No complaints here. The best part of the whole deal was the use of the Club Lounge magnificently hosted by my new mates, Andy & Aki. If someone from the hotel reads this these to fine gentleman deserve recognition. They were very friendly, attentive and knowledgable about HK with many suggestions for our stay. When offered free drinks on the 1st evening they did not have my wife's favourite drink, Jim Beam. Guess what, it was there the next night. the local area has many shopping options including SOGO and Time Square. The MTR is approx 200 mtrs away and offers great transport option for HK. So cheap, clean and regular (I think the longest wait was 4 mins). Many local eateries are in the neighbourhood. there is also a large park over the road which is great for a walk around. Anyone who likes Rugby should consider this hotel as we could see the stadium from our room. Would be excellent for the 7's. We loved this hotel and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Too gaudy for my taste but some great eating places”
Reviews.Author: skywords
Reviews.Content: I must qualify this review by saying that my opinion was hotly debated by my colleagues. Still, it is my opinion! The hotel is done up in Traditional Chinese style but is over decorated with Red and Gold. The check-in staff weren't the most friendly I've met and while the rooms were spacious and comfortable, the taste in decor was consistent (gaudy). There was also this annoying music that was in a loop from the elevators as well as in the room until I figured out what caused it. The fitness room was tiny. Breakfast was rather ordinary by any standards. Now the good parts: Room service was terrific; the food was awesome. There's a great ice-cream cafe in the hotel itself and a fabulous dim sum restaurant in the hotel complex. They also have lovely banqueting facilities if you can grow to appreciate the style. While there was nothing wrong from a service perspective (the check-out was friendly so it could have been that I chose a bad time to check-in) I didn't find too much here to make me want to choose it again among the several properties available here. It is five star and in a good location so don't expect a "great deal" either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great food!”
Reviews.Author: Toetjesfreak
Reviews.Content: The title says it all: great, great and - once again - great! Some minor points for improvement would be check-in time, the front desk would give us the room key before 2pm (we arrived at 1.15pm) and told us to come back later. Also the choice of dumplings for breakfast was a bit limited, as was the rest of the breakfast buffet - especially compared to the JinLing hotel in Wuxi, China, that we just came from. Other than that the hotel is just good, albeit on the high side of the price range. Then again, the location is great and the rooms are clean and comfy, so all in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Rogtan
Reviews.Content: Great location with lots of good food and shopping around the Orel. Easy and convenient to get to from the airport. Just take A11 Airbus and it stops just opposite the hotel in less than 60 mins. Paid HK$40 one way. Hotel also provides free shuttle every hour or so. All these were marred by poor and inflexible service. Booked a deluxe room for two with free breakfast. Upon arrival, told that breakfast only for 1 pax?!? Asked for two card keys as I need to work while my wife goes shopping. But the front counter would only issue 1. Could not explain why not two keys. Overall nice hotel but poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view in luxury”
Reviews.Author: TeoLinuX
Reviews.Content: Rooms above 31st floor are suites with exceptional view and a lot of space (compared to HK standards). One entire side of the room is a glass wall that faces Victoria Harbor. Personnel is caring , kind and always willing to help you. Bed are enormous, the bathroom mixes design with functionality. The entrance hall of the hotel is spectacular. Silence is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Price is right”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is always priced lower than nearby Park Lane hotel. During peak season I usually stay here as the other hotel gets pretty expensive. My room is nice and clean and quite big compared to Excelsior nearby. Near Sogo dept store and Time Square . Restaurants are abundant. There is a michellin rated restaurant beside the hotel

Reviews.Title: “loved it but ...”
Reviews.Author: sabrina-pauliano
Reviews.Content: After just a short time of waiting for check in, we saw the receptionist. Totally cold and rude person ,she took my credit card away, she said that she would charge me fully of i can't remember how many days does she mentioned , as a guarantee. she seems like she was busy doing things here and there.....anyway that is not the mean problem ,well the problem was comunication me and my husband got poor english as we are from France,we asked her does any one speaks french ,and she said we should wait and after an half hour she came back and said "no one can help you everything was in chinese or english",si we called my friend( in paris) to help us for check in by phone because no one could explain us in french the rules that was disapointiing from a 5* hotel ,about the room attendants they were nor friendly and even they couldnt speak simple english it's was not lucky actually ,our first stay in hong kong was in sheraton which has a french speaker as a room attendant that was very sympathic . The room was clean at standart level,the food is great,we planing to visit hong kong at least once for a year,we love to travel and to stay in a warm place as hong kong ,and we would like to invite our friends too but this time we must find some one who could speak french . we will come back for sure a' bientot

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, conveniently situated on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: KJC55
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good hotel in a convenient location. Room was reasonably spacious, clean and tidy with all the necessary amenities. Mr room rate included free internet use. Staff are attentive and helpful without being over the top. Pleasant area for breakfast and lounge area close to lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Regal HK, Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: GeraldJBangkok
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Regal Hong Kong, Causeway Bay on our recent trip to Hong Kong. The hotel is a very busy hotel in a very busy area of Hong Kong, and was very convenient to the MTR Subway, restaurants and shopping. The staff was mostly very friendly and helpful, which is easy for me to say since we were upgraded to a 32nd floor executive floor room with a harbor view. The rooms and lobby are a little gawdy for my tastes, but definitely very clean, roomier than most HK hotels with a gorgeous bathroom with separate shower and bathtub. In the same building of the hotel is a Din Tai Fung Restaurant, which has received a Michelin Star and rated by the NY Times as one of the ten best restaurants in the world. We ate there twice and was very impressed with the food, prices and very friendly and helpful service. There's almost unlimited choices of other restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel is also served by the Airport Rail Link Shuttle buses, and you can get a door to door free shuttle bus if you take the Airport Rail Link into the city from the airport. I would definitely stay at the Regal again. It's very good value for the money with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: garasr
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Hong Kong many times and decided to give the Regal a try due to the value for the money. After having read the mixed reviews for the Regal, we were a bit nervous about our reservation. We fortunately only experienced a very positive situation. Our check in on the Royal Lounge floor was immediate and our room (as promised) was renovated and had a beautiful view. The bathroom was completely redone, with a "rainfall" stall shower and new bathtub. The staff, especially Angela, Flora and Sam were extremely helpful and nice. Oh, almost forgot, the rooftop pool is quite awesome. We look forward to our next trip to Hong Kong and staying at the Regal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Struggling to update and modernize. Amazing pool”
Reviews.Author: jvanyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regal in 94 when it was probably a year old and much more up to date at the time. That said this hotel is in a fantastic location and even the standard rooms are large and not cramped. The downsides of the Regal I would say is that it is in the midst of trying to better itself. One afternoon in dire need of a jet lag nap i discovered that the room above me was having it's floors drilled or something. A call to the manager had them stop work there and he even offered to move me to another room for my nap ( I wouldn't have had to move rooms just nap somewhere else which I thought was a creative solution) I echo the comments made by some others, the non-updated floors have that musty smell that happens in the tropics when the carpeting has been around too long. My biggest complaint with the place however is probably something that has to do with the owners or main managers. There just doesn't seem to be that level of service for a hotel of this caliber that you get at other hotels in Hong Kong and Asia. In the rooms are no fewer than 10 different cardboard advert tents cluttering up the room and bathroom. It feels like the hotel is really just selling you a room in order to sell you more stuff. It is very off putting. Also the wifi issue, horrible and expensive. TV too, they have what look like nice flat screen tvs but the signal and channel selection is really bad. It just seems that there a too many places they are trying to cut corners and it ends up landing in the lap of a less than great experience. If the management got their priorities corrected and put the guest first and not their desire to get into the guest wallet they would probably be able to charge more and get more from customers. One imagines the owners running around demanding answers from staff why they are paying for curtains to be cleaned or why is it costing $x to have a shower fixed instead of pointing in a corner demanding to have things polished better or insisting that carpeting with stains and smells be replaced immediately. You can just feel the cheapness of the owners in the hotel. I wouldn't not stay here again but i'd only be staying if I found a great deal on the room rate. The dumpling restaurant outside the main lobby btw is fantastic. Really great soup dumplings.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding anniversary trip !!!”
Reviews.Author: stylishtrvler
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to HK. This time we tried staying at a diff hotel for our anniversary trip. I wrote in advance to inform the hotel about it but didn't get a reply so I thought the email didn't go thru. We requested for a renovated room and was gladly given one. They even provided fruits and chocolates just not sure if it is a common practice or something special due to my previous email. I assume they read the email and acted upon my request. Didn't try the internet cuz I find 140hk quite expensive. The rooms are big and bed comfortable. Overall it was a nice stay. Will definitely stay here again. had room service at 1am. Service was fast. There are still some renovation work going on at the top floors, but we were informed thru a letter in the room that there might be some noise from 10am to 6 pm. I only noticed some noise past 10am. If you don't plan to stay in the room the whole day, I don't think the noise from renovation work matters. July 1 was a holiday and streets were blocked off. The hotel also sent a letter a day before advising guests leaving for airport to take necessary adjustments.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying our stay, hotel is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: alisoninoz
Reviews.Content: We are in the middle of our stay at the Regal, the hotel is lovely, our room is very nice, fittings and furnishings are good quality. The only down side for me was the lack of information of where the local attractions are and how to get there!!

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing stay, will give this hotel a miss in future”
Reviews.Author: atina2090
Reviews.Content: Have travelled to HK many times but this was the first (and will be the last) time we stayed at The Regal HK. We only chose this hotel because of the swimming pool and close proximity to Causeway Bay shopping district. While the hotel is in a convenient location with tram stop out the front and short walk to MTR, this is probably the only saving grace. Hotel is in dire need of refurbishment and this extends to the rooms. The hotel is suppose to be 5 star - perhaps back in the 1980's given the mirrors, glass, marble and gold/brass fixtures and fittings now bordering on tacky. Our experience was more like 3 stars. We had pre-booked and paid for a 3 night stay in a non smoking deluxe room which we had subsequently confirmed by emailing the hotel. When we arrived we were told that there were no deluxe non smoking rooms available - and to compensate the hotel would be upgrading us to a suite - but only for one night which meant repacking our bags the next morning and changing rooms. After advising the hotel this was extremely inconvenient and our preference was for a deluxe room for the entire stay rather than have to shift rooms mid way, we were advised we could remain in a suite for our entire stay at no additional charge. The room was spacious but the fixtures and fittings very dated and whilst the hotel tried to compensate for this with the replica Florence Knoll sofa and armchair, there is still much work to be done. In terms of cleanliness, the carpet was stained and dirty. The bathroom had a very unpleasant odour and we were forced to keep the bathroom door closed at all times.
