The hairdryer did not work and when we notified housekeeping, rather than sending up a portable hairdryer immediately, they attempted to fix the existing hairdryer. It was was almost 30 mins before I was able to dry my hair (using the portable hairdryer). Floor is supposed to be non smoking, but the guests in the room next to ours were smoking. This became problematic as the cigarette smell was seeping into our room through the gap between floor and door adjoining the two rooms. To rectify this we needed to complain to reception. Hotel is suppose to have WiFi in rooms but the reception was extremely weak. Unlike most other hotels, the Regal HK did not offer free WiFi access in the lobby. Additionally, the cost of WiFi was on the expensive side with room WiFi being the same price as that in the lobby. Whilst the lobby did offer better reception, there was nowhere for guests to sit and relax without being obligated to purchase a beverage, as we were told the lounges were only for use by hotel cafe/bar patrons (and there would be a minimum charge of HKD $40 for use by hotel guests) You could probably describe this as a hotel popular with business travelers and large tourist groups from mainland China. The personal touch and customer service orientation were literally non existent. There are a number of hotels in the same area and whilst a swimming pool might be lacking, they more than compensate for this with features and benefits, contemporary styling and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Stay in The Regal Hong Kong!!!”
Reviews.Author: XoMartel8
Reviews.Content: We regretted every second since we stepped into this hotel, we booked 2 rooms and planming to stay here for 3 days 2 nights, and our stay was started with rude treatment  and totally unprofessional local hire. We arrived at the hotel at around 2:45 pm,and our room was not ready, the late check out time was at 1 pm and in 1 hours 45 minutes of cleaning time the room was still not ready. So they made us linger in the lobby, unfortunately,there are no seats for us to sit on and wai t for the slowww service, there are empty chairs in the lobby lounge but the sitting hostess said that we cannot sit there unless we consume, which i think is so dumb, they have a group of waiting guests (waiting for their slow housekeeper to clean the room) and we are not allowed to even sit on their chair. After 30 minutes of waiting time, the receptionist informed us that it will take them another 45 minutes to get both room ready,that means the rooms were not ready until 4 pm. After complaining, They offered 3 free drink vouchers for 4 of us at the lobby lounge which is the only seating area in the lobby (oh yeah, it's that area where we cant sit unless you consume). We finally got the room, it was small, old, and definitely need to be spring cleaned real bad. Lack of power outlets for us to use, they offered travel adaptor for A price.  To make matter worse, they are having construction work done right above of our room, they were drilling holes all morning, they started at around 10 and yes we were still in the room and even maxing the tv volume doesn't even mask the noise a bit. We finally complained to the receptionist to make them stop for a while or at least work on something else less noisy, the rude receptionist persistently said no we cannot do that because they need to continue working till 6 pm. Breakfast was bad also,not enough selections for this type of hotel,it seems that they are just taking advantage of their location being close to the shopping district thus they can take it easy on service and products. We should have just stayed at other BETTER hotels nearby. WE ARE DEFINITELY NOT COMING BACK!!! And we believe to save your money, you shouldnt also..... Take your money some where else guys....they worth more at other place...Better Service, Better Product DEfINItELY NOT  the regal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Friendly Hotel at Causeway Bay Area”
Reviews.Author: SiaoLan
Reviews.Content: The price for the room is at HK$1500 per night with breakfast and Internet, I find it reasonable for what I am getting. Room is comfortable clean and coz we have 3 pax, it has enough space for me to add an extra bed and don't find it too cramp. The staff that we encounter were friendly and helpful. The chef at the cafe was nice and detail. When I order a scramble egg, he actually check how well done I want it to be. Not much chef does that when they do your egg. Just opps you have Windsor shopping mall and near by SOGO, of coz near to Causeway bay MTR IF there is an event at the Victoria park, you just have to cross the room and you are there. There are enough eating place from good restaurant to simple cafe that you can have breakfast for HK$70 for 3 pax. (of depend on what you order) So if you don't mind paying HK$1500 for a room/ night, I think is a good hotel to consider.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: KarenB08
Reviews.Content: On checking in, staff insisted on charging 2000 dollars for incidentals to my credit card - that worked out at 500 dollars per night. I was told it would not be charged to my card. On checking out, I was told they would refund the money they had taken from my card. What did they think I was going to do? Steal the television?

Reviews.Title: “Regal - Small & beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Essquare
Reviews.Content: Was on a holiday in May 2011 with family. This one in Kowloon city was quite far from the airport. took around 1.5 hrs to reach there.Check in procedures were cordial. Helpful staff. "Always on the move" housekeeping. - do not spend time with you much to answer any questions other than the one you had called them for. Good location with easy access to banks, restaurants, etc. one problem faced was the usual one in some developed countries.Good food with a decent variety - Some cons - No lockable doors for the attached baths- just a sliding glass door and a curtain--- gave a shock initially!!! Restaurant - The indian one did not have any fruits - only juices. Too small rooms. A small lobby for the no,. of rooms available People from INdia need to carry adaptors of mobile phones/laptops etc. as the sockets are all pin type and not the round type ones.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel-Lousy Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: ChipSaunders
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall is a very nice hotel and it is located not too far from the Metro. The rooms are fairly small but aren't too bad. My main complaint is the internet. The wired internet runs around $150 HKD and the Wi-Fi runs at $170 HKD. If you need internet go with the wired, because the only place the Wi-Fi works is in the hotel lobby. In the rooms is a different story. I called the front desk and they patched me through to a tech who basically told me to refresh my computer. Clearly its the rooms if my laptop can hold the signal in the lobby but FAILS when you get back to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Brutal”
Reviews.Author: LloydsPants
Reviews.Content: First time writing on trip advisor but had to give an update on this hotel. Stay in Causeway bay at least once a month and have stayed here numerous times. Bottom line is this hotel is dirty and has terrible service. If your desire is to wait in line at the check in counter for thirty minutes plus or clean your bathroom upon arrival then this is the place for you. One of the positives is the price, which is reasonable for the location. Noticed they will be doing some remodeling soon, but that will not fix the service level at this place. Best bet to stay across the way at Lanson Place Hotel or at the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Nasution
Reviews.Content: It's my 3rd stay in Regal Hong Kong. It's close to everything and good for shopping as it's in the heart of causeway bay. Only one thing as a turn off is the hotel interior. It's a bit too garish for me, with its european style. However, it's very spacious, especially for HK standard. With 2 single beds, you can still have an extra bed and space to move. It's a little too pricey for me, so it's always be my last choice when I run out of options with my other favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “You should stay here”
Reviews.Author: keithwilson30
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Hong Kong with a booking at the Regal Hong Kong Hotel. I had booked for 13 day but changed it to 5 as some of the ratings here were not good. What a waste of time as I was to discover the hotel is wonderful, clean, very helpful staff and very good rooms. The difference from the reports is incredable as I can say nothing bad about the Hotel. it is well positioned to have access to the metro system and has wonderful local eating places close by with good shopping areas around the hotel. This Hotel is so good I am going back 0n the 27th feb after a few days in Macau. Keith Wilson

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff make this hotel a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: fjno1
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Hong Kong as my daughter was having surgery there and had a few reservations as the reviews were a bit critical. I found that this hotel was lovely and in a great location. The staff are a credit to management with perfect English, enthusiastic smiles and great attention to detail. On day one the maitre d' in the restaurant asked why my child was on crutches and we explained that she was having surgery, so on day 3 when we returned for dinner he immediately asked after her and made a real fuss of her. She was thrilled. The rooms were spotless, beds and pillows comfortable. I'll definitely return soon. Also to any fitness addicts like myself the gym is great - all well maintained machines and plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “good quality hotel for the rate i got, not international 5 star level, horrible elevators”
Reviews.Author: sternenklar
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in Causeway bay in HK island. The location is near the subway station causeway bay and they offer a limousine service from the airport which i found very convenient. staff is eager to help and attentative, but could speak better English. Although the hotel claims 5 stars, this is in no way in the league of an international 5 star hotel. the breakfast is very nice and sports a large selection of dishes. the other restaurants however, are not worth going there. the hotel is mainly populated by chinese people (mainland and HK). the elevators take ages to arrive, it drives you mad. once inside you are tortured by generic music that makes you go crazy. the rooms are average. size is nice for HK but they could be more modern. we had a meetinroom booked too. service there was ok but some of the equipment they provided did not work on the first day and had to be replaced. there are some nice shopping areas nearby the hotel and dinning in the area is good (from Asian to nice steaks you can find pretty much everything). disillusioning was the fitnesscenter, which they packed in the basement without any windows and hard to find. it isn't equipped very well (only 2 treadmills) but since hardly anybody seems to use it, i never had to wait. In the basement you can also find the business center, which is small and as usual with these things overpriced, but the ladies of the business center wil ldo everything they can to help you with what they've got. there is a bar on the 31 floor. it's nice and will make ok drinks, but Aqua in TST will be more fun. One remark... as in most places in China you can smoke nearly everywhere in the hotel (including aparently the elevator)... just something to consider. They do however offer non-smoking rooms. Would I stay there again? Maybe if I'd get a really good rate. On full rate.. probably no.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: wendy9145
Reviews.Content: While the location is fantastic - close to tram, MTR and shopping centres, the hotel is awful. For starters, the toilet was filthy - like a public toilet at the end of the day. After having that cleaned, I then found belongings of previous guests under the bed, in the cupboard. The internet for my stay of 10 days cost more than if I signed up for a 2 year plan with one of the local phone companies. It was also sooo slow (about 1-2 secs to type each letter). Everything is extra whereas in other hotels in HK (where I travel 1-2 x per year), there are little things such as newspapers, internet, laundry breakfast included. I had pre-paid my stay and was unable to move. Not good value for money and staff seem unconcerned with rectifying any deficiencies. My advice - stay away!

Reviews.Title: “value for money with good location”
Reviews.Author: winterprincess_10
Reviews.Content: booked 2 superior rooms / Check in : 16 Dec 2010 stay for 3 nites. Despite poor comments on this hotel, decided to book as found it good value with good location. Was given connecting rooms. Service staff at the reception counter was good Rooms are bigger than usual Hongkong room Room serivce was good - had put up the DND sign through out my stay, they left slips under my door informing us to contact them should we need any service from them as they could not clean up our room since the DND sign was on. Concierge staff need much improvement, could not provide good knowledge on travlling option when we approach them for help.

Reviews.Title: “Four star hotel that failed to stay up to it's name and standard”
Reviews.Author: ridewell
Reviews.Content: Duration of Stay (28Nov - 01Dec2010) Room No.1614. Twin room with a roll- away extra bed. Paid for rate at HK$1702.25 nett per room night. Upon arrival, bell boys were very friendly and helpful. Check in by Mr Herman of concierge, but he doesn't seems knowlegable and pro in his job, but was friendly. Housekeeping needed much improvements, we were given only 2 sets of towels daily with 3 of us staying in. Have to ask for extra set everyday. Ask for razor from day 1 but was never even there till check out. Asked for tissue paper replacement, but don't see it after 2 days later. we were given a fairly good extra bed from 28 - 30Nov, but only that i realized after when I settled my full payment of my total hotel bill on 30Nov morning, my roll-away extra bed was changed for no reason into a piece of mattress with springs protruding all over when i came back late night of 30Nov, thus resulting in my sleepless night. When confronted the front desk duty manager Ms Fiona on the day of checking out(01Dec) for an explanation, she simply utter a word of "sorry" without sincerity. She immediately made a phone call to her housekeeping department and ask if they're running out of beds. Never did I expect such bad experience could happened at a four star hotel that carrys the branded name REGAL.This is a lesson learned that you should not pay your room bill in full before checking out or you'll be given this standard of services.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities - lousy service and greedy charges makes this a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: udo_schuklenk
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. It's an odd mix of good value for money (ie the room, location), but then the staff stuff up everything. My aircon didn't work oroperly for three days, yet there was no serious follow-up. It was either freezing cold or boiling hot, but no chance to adjust the thing. At the same time they blast you with advertisements, for wrongly priced - but useful services - like their airport shuttle bus. They advertise it on their house TV channel at 65HK$ (max), when really the charge is 120 HK$. Despite prior booking you can't be certain whether you'll get on the bus you booked, because they overbook the bus as they see fit. I was on a trip where the luggage blocked emergency exits as well as the driver's sight. In case of an emergency we would not have been able to evacuate the bus quickly because all exits were blocked. They charge a breathtaking 170 HK$ for wireless internet access. That alone is a good reason not to stay in this place. Unlike other reviewers I did like the tacky interior design. It is tacky, but not in a cheap way. The pool is small but perfectly located on the 34th floor. Great views from up there. Bottom line, DO NOT stay in this establishment. You might enjoy it, if you're lucky. The moment there is a problem and you rely on the hotel staff acting on it, you're lost.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cas001_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 3 year old in Nov 2010 and would stay here again in future. Pros: - clean room/bathroom - 5 min walk to Times Square, Sogo etc and eateries - close to Victoria Park which has a great playground for kids and running track - courteous staff - nice rooftop pool, however water is not heated so was a bit cold for a swim in November. - good value for money We requested for an extra single bed for our son, and it was provided without any extra charge. This hotel seems to be a popular place for tourists from China and also airline pilots and the lifts may get a bit busy, but we were on a holiday and not on a tight schedule, so didn't mind the wait.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: MT168
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in August and September on my business trip. Located in Causeway Bay next to Jardine crescent, I reckon that this is one of the best tourist shopping spots in Hong Kong. It is about 5 minutes' walk from the Causeway Bay MTR station. I come to this hotel by chance. I actually booked Regal iClub hotel in Wanchai but was given a transfer because the rooms at iClub were under renovation. Since then, I grow to love it. I especially like the airport shuttle service. You can board the shuttle bus at the Regal Airport hotel which is within a few minutes' walk from the airport terminal which will run through a route to Regal hotels in Hong Kong and Disneyland Hong Kong. You can save about HK$600 on taxi fares for a two-way trip to and from airport. The hotel staffs are generally friendly when you approach them. The rooms are quite clean and spacious. The rooms come with broadband access which is a must on my business trip. I booked the room through the official hotel website. Book the rooms early to enjoy better rates. You won't be able to get good rates if you book late.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price, and not as bad as other reviews led me to believe.”
Reviews.Author: maverick83617
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days at Regal Hong Kong. I booked for value then saw some bad reviews on this site after booking, so was prepared for the worst. Turned out that my internet was free unlike reviews claimed, guess it depends on the rate. Also breakfast was free and very nice. No smoky smell in my room. The location isn't great for me although if you like shopping then it is good. Room was a little small, but bed was fine, bathroom was clean and all in all a good room. The gym is 24 hours which I find essential, and was decent with weights not just some bikes and treadmills. Free shuttle from the airport is long as mentioned in other reviews, but they also have a free shuttle from the airport express station if you want to speed things up. Staff was kind, also found them above average for Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service with no smiles”
Reviews.Author: Jesstravelling
Reviews.Content: Despite the many negative reviews I read, we still went ahead to book this hotel because we liked the location. And now I regret to confirm that the reviews of poor service are all true. I've not experienced such cold and unsmiling service at the reception desk of a hotel for a very long time. Every simple request we made was met with confused and annoyed looks. There seemed to be no understanding nor desire to provide service that would make guests feel welcome and taken care of. I would definitely not like to return to this place at all simply because of the bad service.

Reviews.Title: “horrible rooms, way too expensive!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yanick1510
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through internet with a fixed rate prepiad....that's what I thought until I check out. I booked for 140$ a night and then they said they had to charge 10% more + romm fees + mini bar that I didn't use at all (8$ us for a coca cola X 6 = 48$). wifi was 25$ us per mobile and per laptop for a total of 100$ more per night. Furthermore they charged even for laptop that I didn't use. Not possible to talk with the reception at any time. the pool was close for no reason. the rooms were in a horrible condition. leaking shower, small beds, broken windows, etc. I don't recommand this hotel which cost me the double of expected!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vin09
Reviews.Content: The location and appearance from the outside are nice but it was downhill after that. My complaints include the fact they bill you TWICE for the internet if you access it both from your computer and phone. - Each device gets charged (and it's not cheap). The room was showing a lot of age. The bathroom needed a serious renovation and the bed was very uncomfortable. About my only positive comment for this hotel was their restaurant, Zeffirino, which has a very good Italian chef.

Reviews.Title: “Very efficient”
Reviews.Author: Lizzir
Reviews.Content: This staff at this hotel were very friendly and efficient, they were very accomodating and good for tourist information. The hotel rooms were very floral and old school decor but still very comfortable and clean. In the toilet you can have the option of the lift music playing whilst your in there which is always novel, pan piped westlife anyone? Room service was very quick and tasty I had the japanese meal which was gorgeous, but if you are after a quiet room then think again, you can hear the taps from other bathrooms and people in the surrounding rooms above and below and you cannot turn the air con off and it is very loud in the night. The hotel is in the heart of the designer shop area and there are many shopping centres surrounding it. The hotel is very close to the world trade centre and MTR stations. There are also good links to kowloon, however the hotel airport bus does take a while and would advise that you check with the hotel to see roughly how long it takes to get to the airport so you don't miss your flight by choosing the wrong one...all in all a very good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.. greal location - right in the heart of Causewaybay”
Reviews.Author: karanrm
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Hong Kong, and was having problems finding a hotel which fits in my budged due to some Jem and Jewelry fare going on in HK.. Most of the hotels only had premiere and executive rooms available, which were priced really high. Then I went through my corporate travel agent, and managed to get the superior room at Regal Hong Kong hotel at a decent rate. They had a free shuttle service from Airport to Hotel which was very convenient.. though it took like 1.5 hrs to reach Regal HK hotel as it visited all the other regal hotels (kowloon and city) enroute, and dropped/picked other people. Once we reached Regal hotel, to my surprise, I was upgraded to Deluxe room which was wonderful. I was taken to 31st floor where they have a personalized concierge and visitors desk, and my check-in was a breeze.. My room was on 23rd floor and decently sized.. I had to rush to office immediately, so didn't explore other amenities much.. and once back from office, I was mad tired so hit the bed which was very cozy and comfortable, and the linen was clean and thoroughly washed.. I had a very sound sleep.. but next morning, I heard some banging going on outside which was quite persistent.. so I called the reservations desk, who said that there is some renovation work going on.. and they apologize for inconvenience.. I told them I can't sleep with such sound.. and after 10 mins or so, the asst manage (Ms. Karen) called me and she upgraded my room to a premiere room, and shifted me to 27th floor.. This room was pretty much the same as Deluxe room, except, it had a better view and a slightly bigger bathroom.. Since then, I had no issues with any renovation sound or anything.. They have a swimming pool at the top floor (34th floor), which is really wonderful. I just used it once, but the water quality was great, and temperature controlled.. They also had a gym, but I never used it.. The food at the hotel was great.. they had like 3 restaurants, but I only went to one of them on Sunday for the lunch buffet, and it was great food.. The room service was a bit sluggish, and once you order something, it took about 15 mins to get it delivered.. and the lifts too were a bit slow, but this could be due to the full occupancy and lot of people going up and down.. And the best part was that the hotel is right in causewaybay, which is the heart of HK, and a great place for all the shopping freaks.. Overall, I had a great stay at the hotel, and would surely stay here again during my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Regal Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: KanaeS
Reviews.Content: It's old building but staffs are nice and room is comfortable. I've enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HONG KONG”
Reviews.Author: PRABHU60
Reviews.Content: Regal Hong Kong hotel is a business class hotel for the executives. Excellent rooms, good food. Service is very good. It is close to many big suermarkets and can do a quick shopping too. Cabs are always available and the bell desk is ever ready to assist.

Reviews.Title: “recommended for location & convenience”
Reviews.Author: nick_ng
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days last week & found this place conveniently located. The train from the airport took me to the HK station terminal where I caught the free shuttle bus to the hotel (just look for the H2 signs for the free shuttle leaving every 20 minutes). The free shuttle bus also took me from the hotel to the HK station terminal. There's renovation going on so there's hacking, drilling & loud noises but I wasn't in the room long enough to be bothered (you encounter such things from time to time). My room was clean, comfortable, bright & spacious enough. Sogo department store is only a 2-minute walk to the left & across the road. The Causeway Bay MTR is also very nearby (different exits dotted around). And there are lots of eating places to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: bananjana
Reviews.Content: I really had a bad experience in this hotel. Starting with the longest check in time ever... ... then that strong cat smell of an extra old room... ... one bathroom towel per guest... ... a duvet with a sheet on top and another one underneath instead of a decent cover... ... a hair in my bed... ... slow room service... We chose this hotel because of the location and that is true if what you intend is to shop all day long. But if you wish to visit the City center, Kowloon, go to Macao or any other activities, other areas are much better than this one. Conclusion: I would never stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Smells like Mothballs”
Reviews.Author: get0uttat0wn
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here during a business trip. The hotel is very close to the Causeway Bay MTR station and is a few blocks from Times Square Shopping Centre. The Airport Express bus stops here and provides easy access to the express train. Overall the hotel was a bit dated and smelled very strongly of mothballs. The bathroom was a bit musty. The staff was friendly and all spoke English. Overall I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The only Hotel supplying coplimentary drinks for only one person”
Reviews.Author: antoniophilippines
Reviews.Content: The provision of shuttle service is convenient The location is okay The charge for third person riding in the bus cost $110, too expensive This is the first time we experience limited supply of coffe, teas, just one pack each The showeroom is a bit small but everything quite okay

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you can get a good online deal”
Reviews.Author: Liz_and_Fadi
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a secret hotel on "Wotif". Based on this price, the hotel was great value - the location is one of the best on the Island - especially if you like shopping. The rooms are very richly furnished and seemed very clean - my only complaint would be that the non-smoking floors are quite clearly not non-smoking. My room smelled strongly of smoke, and one of my pillows was so pungent I couldn't use it - out in the hallways the smell of smoke was quite bad. The staff were fairly attentive, but overall it's the location that would make me come back to this hotel. It's just a short walk from the MTR, and close to all the great shopping areas of Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but hard beds”
Reviews.Author: Dae_77
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel located close to lots of shopping. The buffet breakfast was nice and the room was clean. I found the bed extremely hard and I do have a firm mattress at home. Also, the in room safe did not work. Everything else was good, and service was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Absoloutely Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Berry88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absoloutely brilliant. We had initially booked into the airport hong kong by mistake (which was in the middle of nowhere!) but the hotel was kind enough to help us transfer to the Regal HongKong which was perfect. It was walking distance from all of the shops and Time Square which was a great place to go and eat. Service was amazing and staff in the lobby were so helpful with recommending places to visit and giving directions. Taxis into the city were really cheap and available right outside the hotel if you don't fancy walking. And there is an underground station located within walking distance to go to kowloon (or you can get the star ferry, an lovely experience!). They also had a free shuttle bus to the airport which was fully air conditioned. They had a rooftop pool and jacuzzi which was quite small but in the evening the views were amazing. I would definately stay here again, location and service was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: Venezuela11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute through Wotif and got a good deal. We paid 880 Hong Kong dollars which is a good value for this hotel. Had we paid more, I'm not sure it would have been worth it. The hotel is dated and parts are somewhat tacky. The elevators, for example have sculpted carpet on the walls. The rooms are of an average size. The bathroom was really showing wear and tear. The TV in our room did not work but several phone calls and visits by two different repairmen finally got it working. There was no apology or compensation given by the staff for this inconvenience. The service was not what one would expect from a five star hotel. A sign in the room warned guests not to drink the water, yet the room did not come with any complimentary bottles of water. A bottle of water for 83 Hong Kong dollars was available for purchase. We were told that the room came with wireless internet. It did, but at a cost of 160 Hong Kong dollars per day. We asked the reception questions about the business center. They answered all of our questions yet they failed to tell us that it was closed during our stay. Duh. I thought the bed was comfortable but my partner thought it was lumpy and did not have a good sleep. The room was quiet. I thought the room smelled like cat pee but my partner didn't. What I loved about the hotel was the rooftop pool. Albeit a bit small, the views from the rooftop pool was amazing. It was a great place to relax. There is a newish gym in the basement but unfortunately one of the major pieces of equipment was broken. The gym did not look like it was being cared for. The hotel is well located in Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “A busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shawny_K
Reviews.Content: The bad: 1. The checked in area I find it rather messy. There is only one queue for both check in and check out. Thus, when the check out counter calls, guest standing at the back for check out is always been seen as cutting queue when the front guests queuing are all checking in. 2. The lobby is always very busy and filled with people. 3. MTR need to walk a bit 4. Price might be a bit steep The good: 1. The location is good for shopping. Short walking distance to Sogo and Times Square. 2. Airport bus stops outside the hotel 3. Staffs are rather helpful 4. Room size is decent

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJBangkok
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on thid hotel during a holiday period ... so it feels unfair to say anything negative. The hotel is in an excellent location for shopping & sightseeing. Level of service is acceptable. However the entire hotel is past its best and looking tired. The rooms are what you would expect from a two or three stae hotel. The hotel seems to specialise in tour parties, particularly from China. These guests seemed to get particularly poor service from the hotel staff. However we were our sightseeing all day so the quality of the rooms was not a major issue. I would not recommend this hotel if you value a high quality room & high level of service. I would recommend it as an inexpensive night time spot after a long day of sightseeing / shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Four star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: WYL
Reviews.Content: I was on business trip on 24-27 Mar 2010. This hotel was chosen because my usual hotel ( Excelsior Hotel) expecting full occupancy … there is a Ruby Seven during this period. The hotel offered free airport transfer . This is a good point if the traveler has spare time to spare to wait for their van set off at fixed scheduled. The trip from airport to Kowloon took 1 hr ( stopping by Regal kowloon) There were 2 staff attended at the Reception.. resulting a long queue in checking in . We waited for almost half an hour because the staff s were frequently interrupted by guest queries. We wondered how the hotel operates with only 2 staff at the reception. As we booked the deluxe king room, it come with a big bath tub and a small shower room. The toilet provide essential soap , shower gel ,shampoo toothbrush etc. But some things like cotton bud, iron and ironing board are missing. The housekeeping is also quite sloppy . I found my hair in the toilet for 3 days. Unsure whether they sweep it every day. Though I did not place the card to request them to change bed sheet , they still change.The taxi queue in the morning is long if you arrive after 8.30am. The hotel is next to jardian street –which is popular with shop selling fish ball noodle etc. For me, I did not spent a lot of time in the hotel because I need to work during the day. But the nearby eatery is a plus because they operate until 11pm. Regal Hotel ,pls brush up on your reception!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, convenient location, all around great trip”
Reviews.Author: dandy1983
Reviews.Content: We were in HK with a family group of adults from Dec 09 - Jan 10. We stayed at the regal for 2 weeks and found it a fantastic hotel in a great location. It was decorated beautifully for Christmas and the New Year. It was an easy walk to the MTR station (causeway bay) and surrounded by some nice authentic local eatteries, as well as it's fair share of 7/11s! Taxis were always at hand and easy to get to. The staff were very helpful, especially the room service staff. We ordered room service on a number of occasions and it was always prompt and tasty. Twice we ate the buffet breakfast downstairs, which was a fairly standard breakfast buffet for asia although still nice. The pipe duct replacement didn't bother us as we were usually out in the daytime, although we had one small issue with the bathroom roof leaking quite badly towards the end of our stay. Maintaince came and fixed it promptly however. We had three rooms booked as part of the group we were with. The room my fiance and I shared was tasteful (seemed to have been recently renovated) and not nearly as 'over-the-top' with gold gilt as the other rooms had. Rooms were on the small side but clean, and housekeeping was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Parisglobaltraveller
Reviews.Content: The location is great if you're on a business trip like I was, good service, friendly and warm overall. Hotel looks a bit tired and could do with some make up/refurbishment. Would recommend the hotel to any business travelelr and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are uncomfortable, location is good though”
Reviews.Author: PlasticTrees
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to the executive room on 32nd floor as the hotel was full and I stayed with my spouse who was in HK on a business trip. OK I don't normally complain on this forum but let's start with the things I didn't like about this hotel : Firstly, the hotel design is flashy and overly ornate without taste - think mirrors on every conceivable wall surface, chandeliers hanging from all ceilings, elaborate "baroque" carvings on cornices and columns, and gold paint on everything else. There is a general muskiness in the air and the hotel seems dated (though clean). My room, despite being an executive room on one of the highest floors, was rather small with a queen sized bed, small work desk and cupboard and a 42 inch flat screen tv. The whole room somehow looked ridiculously yellow due to the copious amount of gold used on all walls and even the ceiling. Ceiling was high and there were nice views from the full height window - you could look out between some buildings, to the harbour. The bed was one of the most uncomfortable I have ever slept on, save for my backpacking days way back then. The mattress is shockingly hard and thin - it feels like you are sleeping on a wooden plank with a thin layer of sponge laid over it. The pillows lose their shape once you lie on them and after a couple of minutes, you will find they have been compressed to the thickness of a pancake. I asked for a "deluxe memory foam pillow" from their "pillow menu" in hopes of a better sleeping experience. This "deluxe" pillow turned out to be as hard as piece of plastic, I kid you not - I must have misunderstood their description or maybe they have a different idea of what "deluxe" means. That said, the room, despite its awkward lack of aesthetics, taste, overall comfort and general sense of muskiness in the air, was clean and properly maintained with relatively new fittings. Service was acceptable, with prompt responses to some small requests, but there was nothing that really made you feel extra special as a guest. The good points are : The location - very conveniently located within comfortable walking distance (3 min walk) to Causeway Bay station and a busy shopping node. Lots of shops and local eateries in the immediate vicinity. Free shuttle bus to Hong Kong station (to get to the airport) which departs every 10 minutes. But be sure to jump onto the bus once you see it - if the driver is late on his schedule, he will just shoot off after waiting for just 5 seconds. That happened to me and the hotel manager just looked haplessly on. Free internet. Apparently they have a really fantastic Italian restaurant on the 31st floor but I didn't try it. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel because of the uncomfortable bed and the musky over elaborate design. The bed is really a dealbreaker for me because I think it's important to feel rested and fresh for your day of sightseeing.... Unless you get a really fantastic price for this hotel compared to Excelsior or ParkLane which are also in the vicinity, and you are only staying for a few days OR unless they do something about their beds and mattresses, I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: reise999
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel in Jan 2010 for two nights. The room is ok on a first look. But you find very soon how poor the cleaning standard is. I spotted precious gusts hair on the room floor, bath room and the window area. I wonder whether they even vacuum the room floor after every check-out. The front desk staffs are not professional. They speak in such a manner that they are just there to finish the task. They seldom smile and seem not at all to be ready to help you. The hotel pretends to be a good or great hotel. But it is a third class hotel with old facility.

Reviews.Title: “good city hong kong”
Reviews.Author: abhishek94
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the hotel was comfortable . The room was not quiet big but very cozy for two people but it cant accomodate children .The scene from the window was not very encouraging as it was in the main kowloon market area. the rates were bit high compared to the quality .

Reviews.Title: “Regal Hong kong is a top Hotel in a very good area.”
Reviews.Author: nuages
Reviews.Content: The Regal hong Kong is well located in Causeway Bay, close to MTR, Harbour, shops, markets etc with easy access to many attractions on the island. We took the Royale Platinum option which includes an extensive range of add ons including, free airport shuttle, free late checkout, breakfast, afternoon tea, cocktail hour, executive floor, dedicated checkin etc. very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience to shop around”
Reviews.Author: xaustralia
Reviews.Content: I was impress when I check-in, The girl at the Reception desk Panffy (not sure) with big eyes gave me a warm welcome with smile, after checked-in she gave me a map to show me where is the best place to shop. My room was on the 28/F facing part of the park and part of the harbor. What a view.......

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: poidog7
Reviews.Content: While not disagreeing with some of the negative comments in recent reviews, I give this hotel 5 stars because it is a very comfortable hotel that can be had for a reasonable price. If you reserve a room on the internet, you can get a spacious, clean, quiet room for about 1,100 Hong Kong dollars. We had absolutely no problems during our stay. The staff was attentive and very fast. We put the "do not disturb sign" on our door whenever we were in the room to avoid room checks whereby someone might open the door at anytime. The decor of the room and the hotel does not suit my taste, but it wasn't enough to bother me. The room was very clean and comfortable. By reserving the room on the internet, the internet access was provided at no extra charge. Both ethernet and wireless were available. If you are forced to pay for it, it will be HK $6/min. or HK $170 maximum for 24 hours. Thus it's best to get the free internet if you can. The location is great-- lots of shops in Causeway Bay and near all manner of transport, including the subway. The chinese restaurant on the third floor was absolutely first rate, but expensive. Recommend trying Mak Noodle shop nearby for unbeatable won ton noodles (ask the concierge for directions). There is a complimentary shuttle bus to and from the airport. Call ahead for directions and times-- you have to go to the Regal Airport hotel, which is next to the airport and about 5 minutes by foot. The bus runs on a fixed schedule and is a good way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “I loathed this hotel - but it was good value!”
Reviews.Author: poppag_girl
Reviews.Content: My real issue with this hotel is a matter of taste. Dated 'Renaissance' isn't really my thing and I found the whole decor an affront to the senses. So if you like this style - you are much more likely to like this hotel. In terms of pros: the hotel is in a good location, close to the MTR, has decent sized rooms and is clean (housekeeping were lovely), safe and was really good value. On the negative side - there is no bar; nowhere to relax unless you are in the 'club floor' (which didn't seem worth the bother to me); the wi-fi didn't work in the room; the internet was expensive (in many hotels internet is free nowadays); the toiletries are minimal (I spent the first few days going out to buy basics); the bathroom grout needed re-doing; the 'free' newspaper was indeed a free newspaper (the one you get at the MTR station); the door staff only ever opened the door near them (not the one I was going out of); the coffee shop looks like a gilt version of a staff canteen and the decor (personal taste, I know) is utterly vile. Oh & the pool is pretty crap too. So if you don't mind the decor and you need a room for the night - it is a good bet. If you are there for 3 weeks and are interested in Interior Design, run for your life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Championofchampion
Reviews.Content: It was my second stay in Hotel regal hongkong. It was nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: bambino68
Reviews.Content: We liked it very much, service was very good, rooms big and clean, location super many shops, restaurants, and metro near by. Convenient bus from airport to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kamishdelhi
Reviews.Content: On the new business side of Hong Kong it has a great accessible location. We were a part of a large group visiting Shanghai and HK and so stayed for 3 nights and were able to do all sight seeing and even go kowloon easily from here.

Reviews.Title: “My first stay”
Reviews.Author: Henny_Smith
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in down town, I can see part of the harbour from my room. I got a warm welcome by the Bellman when I check-in, staff at the front desk are friendly and helpful. Worth trying

Reviews.Title: “Two star service at a Five star price.”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonJ
Reviews.Content: After having to endure a half-hour wait to even approach the check in counter, we found ourselves confronted by possibly the slowest and most frustratingly inept staff in all of Asia. No mean feat given the competition for this title on the Chinese mainland. The English spoken is pidgin at best, the staff have no consistency whatsoever as regards upgrade fees, etc (it differs depending on who you speak to), the simplest of requests or questions are met with baffled silence, and the manager is harder to pin down than Spring-Heeled Jack. For the price paid it was altogether a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: specialk8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one week and very much enjoyed our stay. Staff were pleasant and friendly. They had already arranged a late check out for us as we had a late flight home. We also ate in the two restaurants and thoroughly enjoyed our meals. We also had breakfast one morning and the buffet was out of this world. We were unfortunate in that we only got 3 days of good weather and so only managed to the rooftop pool once. My one criticism would be that while we were there, men were working at the poolside and made me feel slightly uneasy. Other than that the location was great and we would happily stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nickray1
Reviews.Content: Very nice, tidy hotel. Very centrally located and only a 5 minute walk to timesquare. Unfortunately it was cold when I was in Hong Kong so it to cold to take a swim in the pool which is situated on top of the hotel. The view however from the top is amazing! The only small problem I had was when asking for an aspirine (tough night in the dragon-I club). Hotel staff could not get me one.. :-( Other things which I can recommend is going to a place called Stanley (only 20 min by taxi). Close to HK but very peaceful and beautiful. Remind my of Mallorca in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaguar08
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel in a good location. (a) Service Without exception the staff of the hotel were friendly, helpful and responsive. Check-in was fast and efficient, check in staff provided information on hotel facilities, found an available room to meet our requested configuration, and were professional and friendly. Concierge provided us with good recommendations for restaurants, shopping and information on surrounding area. F&B staff were attentive without being obtrusive. Housekeeping provided us with extra towels and made-up room on request. In fact, I have never stayed at a hotel where housekeeping responded as fast as at the Regal Hong Kong (and I stay in hotels around 45 days a year). (b) location In Causeway Bay the hotel is located near MRT stations, shopping centres, and markets. Many local chinese restaurants provide ample options for meals at very very good prices! Sogo Department store, local shops, and up-market boutique's all in easy walking distance. (c) Ambiance Whilst the decor may not be to everyone's taste (see website for photos), the hotel was neat and spotlessly clean. The rooms (Deluxe) were good size with good sized bathrooms (including separate bath and shower). The view from the 19th floor was of surrounding high-rise buildings with a small glimpse of the water through a gap between the buildings. Room included table with 2 chairs, a king-sized bed (good support, not too soft), a flat-screen TV, and a couple of mirrors. (d) Facilities A roof-top swimming pool provided excellent views of the surrounding area. We did not have occasion to use other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Club Floor Room!”
Reviews.Author: mensuno
Reviews.Content: Reached hotel at midnight due to my flight. The check in was a breeze and the counter staff who assisted my check-in took less than 5 mins to settle me to my club floor. Before I left the counter, he assured me mine is facing a seaview. The hotel lobby looked ok to me, not that bad after all when I was walking towards the lift. It is indeed the old european style but I think it is still acceptable for Hong Kong standard. The Club floor is from Level 31-35, where level 31 is the club floor lounge area. I was pretty impressed as they have 2 exclusive and private lift access to club rooms. You will require a key card to go to your floor, unlikely the rest of the non-club floors. I presume they have renovated fully their club floors as the carpeting and lighting are different from the rest of the floors. Of course, it smells so much pleasant. When enter my room, it is full of mirrors all over with high ceiling. It is trying to make the room looks bigger but i guess even without it, the 29 sq ft room still acceptable for me. I was pretty impressed with their amenities. They have ipod system, DVD player, coffee blender and a large 42 inch LCD TV. They have all I want to have in this room for a relaxed holiday, apart from shopping of course. Their bed is queen size, though at the hard side, but it is still ok for me. Most interesting for me, is that they have a pillow menu! You can choose different types of pillows for your stay. This is definitely a plus point for the hotel. The bathroom is equiped with a rain shower (quite strong) and a triangular shaped bathtub, interestingly they have included a rubber duck and bath salt for you to soak your body and enjoy it. There is no lock as the shower cubicle and bathroom door are glass walls. You may feel uneasy if you are sharing with friends, but couples or families are fine. They provided a digital weighing machine, and it can also measured your BMI, etc. This is so cool. As for the breakfast, you have a choice of taking at the lounge (with spectacular view while taking breakfast or teabreak) or the cafe. Both are equally good, so you do not worried about it. The cafe design, again it looks tacky, but still it is their style of the hotel. I just concern about their food, which is good enough for me in Hong Kong, though the main good food in Hong Kong should be their local delights! In addition to all, they provide free internet access, 2 PCs for you to use at their lounge, free rental of DVD, free shuttle to certain places such as airport, disney, their regal group of hotels, etc. in hong kong for hotel guests. Not to forget, their roomtop pool was recently renovated and oh my, the view is needless to say, breathtaking with the whole view of Hong Kong island city skyline... what else you need other than a soak in the pool side enjoying the wonderful scenery? Location is undoubtly one of the best in Hong Kong island where it is just near to any part of Causeway Bay. Overall, this is a very good hotel for me during my stay using their club floor facilities. Despite the checkout is a little longer, but it is still manageable with 4 front desk staff to take care of, as long as your time is not their peak period. I will definitely to stay here again straight away if I have gotten the same good deal I have gotten. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: SixContinents
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business in Hong Kong. Overall an older property with older bathrooms, OK for a business trip but probably better suited as a tourist hotel, with a its great location in Causeway Bay. Pros - Fitness center has new equipment, is reasonably sized for a hotel and has been recently renovated. Includes 3 treadmills as well as other cardio equipment and some free weights and machines. - Bell service efficient for arrivals and catching taxis. - Served by airport express bus from Central or a HK$40 taxi ride from the airport express train station at Central (at HK$100 the airport express is generally the fastest way from Hong Kong airport compared to HK$400 for a taxi). Regal also has a bus direct from the airport but that only runs every 60-120 minutes and can take over 90 minutes for the trip. - Good breakfast buffet with a selection of hot and cold western breakfast items plus some asian food choices. - Housekeeping was prompt when an iron and ironing board was requested. Cons - Didn't find the bed that comfortable, and despite air conditioning the room was humid in June. - No complimentary bottled water in the room and tap water not recommended. Instead hotel minibar charges HK$45 for a 500ml bottle of Evian (by comparison, HK$6 will buy a 1,500 ml generic bottled water at the local Wellcome grocery store a 5 min walk from the hotel). - Hotel laundry is also expensive, at HK$75 for a shirt. With the humidity,if you wash anything yourself it may not dry in 24 hrs. In summary, hotel somewhat overhypes itself on their web site and reminded me of an older, somewhat tired out Vegas hotel. That said, for the price of the room it can be a fine stay in a great location on Hong Kong island.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, strange decor...”
Reviews.Author: Saking
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regal Hong Kong hotel for 5 nights in March and paid £58 per night with BA holidays. At the time most of the 4 star hotels were at least double this price. After reading the tripadvisor reviews I was a little unsure of what to expect but as the price was so cheap I decided to go ahead with it. On reflection I was pleased I did. The staff on the reception was polite and friendly, but apart from checking in and out I didn't have any need for any dealings with them. I'm not sure if it's general hotel policy but upon checking in I was asked if I wanted to upgrade to a suite for approximately £50 extra per night. It provided numerous extra benefits such as the suite (!), free Internet access, buffet breakfast and a shoeshine service (!) amongst other things but I'd prefer to spend £200 in Hong Kong rather than the accommodation so declined the offer. The hotel room was very clean although a little on the small side. However, it contained a large en-suite with a big circular bath. Mini bar, safe, air con with controls and the usual other facilities were present. There were also bottles of water and other snacks in the room but these were ridiculously priced (as an example a bottle of water was about £4.) Internet access is available within the rooms but again this was quite pricey and only available with a laptop i.e. no TV Internet access. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is close to the Causeway Bay MTR and has plenty of places to eat surrounding it. There are also loads and loads of shops in the surrounding area and plenty of malls. In fact, if you like shopping it's an ideal location! The hotel contains several restaurants. However, we only ate at the restaurant on the first floor and although the food was very good it was quite expensive. There are plenty of other decent and cheaper restaurants in close proximity to the hotel. Being really picky, the only negative I could mention is the strange decor throughout the hotel and the rooms. After reading the reviews I expected the worst but I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel, and would not hesitate to stay there again when I return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels at better prices”
Reviews.Author: Lock_yan
Reviews.Content: Service is awful. Housekeeping sends extra pillows and doonas without their cases or separate from their cases. Takes them about half hour to get these things to you. They also have a tendency to go into your hotel room everytime you leave it. Checking in took a long time. Cleaniness is average. Spa tube in the room needed to be recleaned before we could use it. Rooms are older than what they look on websites etc. Does not live up to the number of stars it claims to be. There are much better quality hotels at lower prices in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ErikaSawajiri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Regal Hong Kong Hotel with my family for our vacation in Hong Kong last week. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the city and is surrounded by a number of shopping malls, which is the reason why I made my reservation as both myslf and my wife love shopping. We were offered a newly renovated room with a great view of the harbour. Unfortunately the swimming pool was under renovation otherwise it would be a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Louis XV meets chrome”
Reviews.Author: JohnSSSydney
Reviews.Content: This is one of the strangest hotels I have stayed in. The reception is a disaster, incredibly busy and shambolic. The decorations are flamboyant to say the least - think Louis XV meets the 1980s. I arrived at midnight to check in and waited fifteen minutes before being seen. I then had to sign an acknowledgement of a change to room rates. My agent had advised it was a flat HKD1500 per night but the rate changes were all ofver the place for the two weeks that I was staying. I agreed to the rate changes since overall they worked out to be HKD1500 per night. To my room, the swipe card didn't work so again down to reception to face more chaos. The room itself was great. Quiet, good bath but the internet didn't work despite not being free. The breakfast buffet is extensive and offers good quality food but the free paper was a local freebie and fairly trite. Then the phone messages began: would I accept a rate change for two nights? I agreed. Then the next day, another phone message from reception, another rate change, this time more expensive. I refused and got the travel agent to take over. The same rate change game happened to a work colleague of mine. After two weeks I was glad to check out. At reception I was told I had watched fee paying movies and would be charged HKD196, trival in comparison to the HKD21,000 bill but I refused. the receptionist immediately lowered the cost to HKD98. Again I refused and after 20 minutes of arguing, the receptionist advised I was the type of guest who caused problems. Definitely stay in Causeway Bay but avoid this hotel; stay in the nearby Lanson if you want a peaceful stress free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Labeep
Reviews.Content: Regal Hotel was a good experience. It was part of the package we bought along with the tickets, to save some money (and spend it shopping in Hong Kong!!!) Located in Hong Kong island, next to Victoria Park it was comfortable and clean. The location was very close to trams and subway station ( Causeway Bay ). Causeway Bay is a very animated area, plenty of buzz, shops and restaurants. The hall was grandiose, a little on the tacky side, with chandeliers and always buzzing with activity. Allow me to invent a word "Trumpesque" (I have been a tad too much in Atlantic City, I am afraid...) The staff was friendly and a lot of different services were offered, like massage and fitness center, as well as a terrific swimming pool in the last floor with a great view of Hong Kong! They had a good buffet for breakfast with Cantonese and continental food, from noodles and dim sum to cereal, fruit, bacon, eggs and omelettes cooked on the spot with the toppings of choice. Our room was big enough to be comfortable for two weeks, with a desk and extra seat. In the bathroom, we had a nice round sunk bathtub where I took a dip as soon as I arrived ! :) So, overall, a good experience for a stay of two weeks :)

Reviews.Title: “WARNING "IN ROOM MINI BAR / EVIAN MINERAL WATER"”
Reviews.Author: khuranaa
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler who aways travel staying at the different hotel around the world this case is the worst. I have just returned from REGAL HONG KONG after checked out I return to the reception desk for some inquiry where I was told, there is mini bar bill that has not been paid. I was quite surprise as I didn’t touch anything, but I was told that I had open two bottle of EVIAN WATER and the bill is around HK$120. I asked whether I can see the actual bottle that I was accused of opening. For the second time I was shock to see two bottle of EVIAN still “FULL” BUT THE SEAL CAP WAS ALREADY BROEKEN. was speech less. This scam made me look like a fool or a low life who drank the Evain water and have it filled back with tap water. After a long battle with the reception employee I was told that I don’t have to pay, which surely I won’t. But anyway, it had made me look very low life in front of the people nearby. WATCH OUT!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, easily to get food and shopping till late...”
Reviews.Author: travel:)hippo
Reviews.Content: My sister and myself stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. Despite the hiccup during the check-in process, we got a nice room that is quite large (by HK standard) with a queen's bed. It is definitely a plus with the free shuttle service thru/fro HK International Airport. The location is great as it is within 5 mins walk to MTR and along the way and within the vicinity (if you do venture/circle far), you can easily find food and they are quite reasonable. We tried breakfast, lunch, dinner and supper (~ 10pm) there and truly enjoyed them. Our varities range from porridge, egg tart, dim sum, noodles to goose meat rice! Most, if not all, shops surrounding the area opens quite late into night, so you can do late night shopping too, however this depends what you are looking for. Surely recommend staying here if I visit HK again.

Reviews.Title: “Very 80s in feel”
Reviews.Author: velvetcrush
Reviews.Content: Bad idea to visit Hong Kong during the convention weeks, where hotels were either fully booked out or charged exorbitant rates. I stayed for a week at the Regal Hong Kong hotel at Causeway Bay, due to the unavailability of the very highly rated Conrad for a business trip at the end of October. Plus point: The hotel is situated conveniently near the centre of the Causeway Bay area for a variety shopping and dining options. It is about a 5-minute walk along Yee Wo street which was filled with characteristic local eateries to get to the middle of the action. The size of the room is definitely bigger than some of the Hong Kong hotels I've stayed. Minuses: This is subjective, but the Parisian-inspired deco makes one feel like being back in the 80s (crystal chandeliers, orange lighting, classic-looking room furniture). Definitely not my type of hotel. I was also quite bothered to find that the room was carpeted, smelt musky and the bath towels were soiled. The pillows were also too soft for sleeping. However, it also appears to be tremendously popular with the Asian tour groups so valet service tends to be either lackadaisical or you won't even be noticed as you enter the hotel lobby. Unfortunately, I would not return to stay if I had a choice, due to the overall unpleasant experience. Try Lanson Place or Jia which is just across the road and is possibly for people who prefer new modish rooms at approximately the same prices or just by paying a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Cowombat2
Reviews.Content: I am staying here as I write. My local secretary booked this because all desirable hotels were booked out this week and I gave zero notice of coming. This place is tatty. It tries a baroque'ish style, but then has items in the room that try to be 21st C modern in design - eg the room service menu stuck in a holder. While it has been repainted etc, there are many shortcomings such as getting into the lift, and the light on the button for my floor doesn't work, the cracked tiles in the bathroom, no phone on the desk, safe deposit box doesn't work, ac which is turned up to 26 degrees on the display, but is really about 17 degrees in the room. I tried the gym yesterday. $50 HK entry fee for a tiny room with 6 machines, one of which was broken. I tried a treadmill, but the controls seemed not to work. The attendant had no idea how to program it, so it also was unusable. At HK$1600 for an executive room incl internet and breakfast, this is way over-priced. For this money I expect reasonable decor and facilities that work properly.

Reviews.Title: “Gravely under-par”
Reviews.Author: yrtx4e
Reviews.Content: Regal Hong Kong situated at the quiet end of Causeway Bay, a major shopping area on the island. It's 10-min walk through elevated footbridge from the subway station. The room is standard and the room is kind of worn out. Our room had a dampen odor which we gathered is from the carpet. It claimed to be a 4-star hotel, at most I can rate it as a 3-star judging from other high quality 4-star hotels in other Asian cities that we visited. The grave disappointment was their flagship restaurant --Zeffrino on the top floor. We treated friends from California who stayed at the Hong kongPeninsular Hotel for lunch there. The restaurant is extremely short of staff. We arrived at 12:25pm The restaurant was 1/3 filled with only two servers running around as reception host and servers. No matter how competent the two servers were, many guests were receiving inadequate service. The lunch menu was disappointing comparing to many lunches we had at other 4 or 5 star-hotel restaurants. We had to entice our guests to choose from the more expensive a la Carte menu instead. Fortunately, two management staff were crusing in the restaurant, I approached them and made a courteous complaint. I was astounded to hear the defence from the Accounting Director. I was told there was a private function at the other end of the restaurant that rendered the short of staff!!! I wondered how come they didn't close the restaurant to cater to that private function rather ignoring the restaurant patron at large!!!!! I found that discriminating explanation hilarious for a renowned Regal chain in Hong Kong!!!. At around 1:15pm, the peak of the lunch hour, we saw a few more servers, a reception hotess and a gentleman who possibly be the Maitre d'hotel gradually phasing in. We were pretty embarrassed to treat our friends there with such under-par service. There are many choices in Hong Kong for quality accommodations and gourmet cuisine. However, Regal chain may not be our choice on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “okay..not great...”
Reviews.Author: annika59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because most of our other regular hotel choices in Hong Kong were not available. Overall the hotel was alright, the location, as was mentioned early was excellent. Just a stone's throw away from the Causeway Bay shopping district, there were also many excellent local food outlets nearby. One main gripe about the hotel is the decor. I got the whole idea of the "Regal" hotel, but the decor was a bit too much to take. There were simply too many paintings hanging around--both in the corridor and in the rooms. One thing the rooms could have done more with was lighting. The room did not have a central light, so even with all the lights on[foyer, bedside, table and standing lamp included], the room was still rather dim. The hotel room is also covered with mirrors--just like the hotel lift--you don't have to worry about whether your hair is out of place because there are plenty of opportunities to check yourself before stepping out of the hotel. The staff at the hotel was thoughtful though--we were 3 to a room and they brought 3 sets of everything without our asking. I'm not so sure about how clean the room is though, the room slippers(provided by the hotel) that we used remained in the exact same place before and after the room cleaning. Overall though, the hotel felt clean and and more or less felt like a 4* hotel, albeit one on the lower end of the spectrum.

Reviews.Title: “A good standard hotel with excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowtraveler_79
Reviews.Content: Being a well travelled travel agent, I have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world. For example, the last two times I was in Honk Kong for work, I stayed in both the Shangri La and the Peninsula. I moved to the Regal after being displeased with a previous hotel for a 4 night stay, and although its not anywhere near the standard of some of the other higher rated hotels, it is still worthy of its 4* status. The location is excellrent, within easy walking distance of Causeway Bay. The gym is need of a little work but I have seen a lot worse. The rooftpop pool is very pleasent. The decor is not old-fashioned, it is in a 'Regal' style. It is the way they want it to look and I felt that although it was nice, it was trying to be a little too opulent for its own good. I don't know about what type of room the previous reviewer stayed in because my room was very large, with two double beds, floor to ceiling windows and a very spacious bathroom, which had a corner bathtub and seperate shower. Apparently each room has a huge individually commisioned painting above each bed, above ours was one of a butterfly, which at first I thought was a little garish but grew to rather enjoy it. If I was travelling on a budget, or if I couldn't get into the nicer hotels then I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is never a 4* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited The Regal Hotel in Hong Kong in February and thank God it was only a short stop on our trip. The Hotel is rated as a 4* hotel but I have stayed in better hotels that were only rated with 2*! The decor is so terribly out of date, the rooms are incredibly small and every time we turned the lights on they blew. The gym was located in the basement of the hotel and was in a tiny room that consisted of about 4 machines. In fact every aspect of this hotel was old, grubby and needs a huge overhaul. The only positive asecpt was the staff, they were friendly, polite and extremely helpful. I would never stay at this hotel again.

HotelInfo.Name: Regal Hongkong Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.88 Yee Wo Street, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong, China
